listing_jobDesc: Headquartered in Dublin, DeviceAtlas Limited is an expert provider of mobile web technology solutions that help companies reach their customers, no matter what the device, the content, or the context. DeviceAtlas Limited holds multiple patents on device recognition and intelligence. Products include the DeviceAtlas device intelligence solution, DeviceAssure and developer tools such as mobiReady.We are looking for a mid-to-senior level engineer to join our small team. If you have 5+ years experience in System Administration, Operations, DevOps, or Site Reliability engieering, we want to hear from you.Required skills/experience:Linux system administration.Knowledge of web protocols, e.g. HTTP, TLS, DNS, etc.Experience running customer facing services in cloud platforms such as AWS.Programming/scripting skills, preferably Python or bash.Experience with database administration, e.g., MySQL.You will be required to participate in a 24/7/365 on-call rotation.Nice-to-have skills:Experience migrating and managing services in Kubernetes.Experience building CI/CD pipelines with tools such as Jenkins, Docker, Nexus, and Rundeck.Experience with a configuration management system such as Puppet.Experience deploying and managing a Prometheus based monitoring system.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentPay: €65,000.00-€75,000.00 per yearBenefits:Additional leaveCompany pensionGym membershipPrivate dental insurancePrivate medical insuranceSick payWork from homeSchedule:Monday to Friday Headquartered in Dublin, DeviceAtlas Limited is an expert provider of mobile web technology solutions that help companies reach their customers, no matter what the device, the content, or the context. Job Details: Our client is looking for a qualified Mobile developer to join a Engineering team. You will be working with engineers to develop and maintain high-quality mobile applications using Flutter. If you’re passionate about mobile platforms and translating code into user-friendly apps, we would like to meet you. As a Mobile developer, you’ll collaborate with internal teams to develop functional mobile applications, while working in a fast-paced environment. Ultimately, you should be able to design and build the next generation of our mobile applications.‍Roles and Responsibilities: Support the entire application lifecycle (concept, design, test, release and support)Produce fully functional mobile applications writing clean codeGather specific requirements and suggest solutionsWrite unit and UI tests to identify malfunctionsTroubleshoot and debug to optimize performanceDesign interfaces to improve user experienceLiaise with the Product development team to plan new featuresEnsure new and legacy applications meet quality standardsResearch and suggest new mobile products, applications and protocolsStay up-to-date with new technology trendsRequirements and skills  * Proven work experience as a Mobile developerExperience with FlutterDemonstrable portfolio of released applications on the App store or the Android marketIn-depth knowledge of at least one programming language like Swift and JavaExperience with third-party libraries and APIsFamiliarity with OOP design principlesExcellent analytical skills with a good problem-solving attitudeAbility to perform in a team environmentBSc degree in Computer Science or relevant fieldJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: €60,000.00-€80,000.00 per yearBenefits:FlexitimeSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Dublin, County Dublin: reliably commute or be willing to relocate with an employer-provided relocation package (required) Job Details: Our client is looking for a qualified Mobile developer to join a Engineering team. As a Full Stack Developer in DropChef, you’ll be given the space and responsibility to lead development on new features, do deployments of our app and website, and make your mark on our service.We’re looking for someone who can work across the full stack, from writing database queries to wiring up a UI. You’ll be working with a React Native/Redux app, fetching data from a NestJS REST API, which connects with a Wordpress/WooCommerce CMS. You’ll be using modern tooling, working in a NX monorepo, hosted on GitHub.You’ll work on a breadth of interesting projects such as:Creating an interactive recipe feature for customersMaking a React Native Web build of the current app and adapting the UI for browserBuilding automated pipelines for app and web deploymentMigrating the current infrastructure to AWS and hosting a high availability solutionYou can view our full tech stack here: https://stackshare.io/dropchef/dropchefResponsibilities:Development of new features across the entire stack, and maintaining the current features of the siteDeploying new versions of the app to App Store / Play StoreWorking with our product and operations team designing and defining requirement for new features for both our customers and our staffWorking with our customer success team on solutions to any customer issuesAssisting the marketing team with our analytics solutionsHolding the code to a high quality standardAbility to work independently, we’re looking for a self-starterNeeds:BSc or equivalent in Computer Science ( 2H1 or higher )Proven experience developing mobile applications on iOS/Android3+ years experience developing with frontend frameworks such as React/Angular/Vue etc.Experience working in Redux / similar state management systemsExperience with NodeJSExperience building REST APIs and in API designUnderstanding of secure software development, awareness of security pitfalls in web and mobile app development.Desirables:Experience with PHP/MySQL and building features/plugins for Wordpress/WoocommerceExperience with AWS ECS, Lightsail, RDSExperience with TypeScriptAnalytics solutions experience, integrating with Google Analytics/Facebook/Segment/etcFamiliarity with OneSignal/similar push notification servicesFamiliarity with AWS CloudwatchWhat We Offer:Flexible working hours and locationGet a DropChef meal kit every week!5% Employer Pension ContributionJob Type: At CGA Technology we are proud of every aspect of our company. We work hard independently to build great things together as a team. Our clients know that we give them both an excellent product and service to ensure their success.We are based in Galway City with a team of young multinational professionals specialising in Software Development, New Product Development, Client Management and Training. We value the importance of workplace wellbeing developing long term connections and relationships with everyone we work with. A family-run business since 2011, we offer a fun, energetic, hard-working environment with a flexible and dynamic approach.We are looking for a IOS Developer to join our technical teamResponsibilities· Designing and maintaining mobile apps· Work on an agile engineering team developing maintainable and scalable code for the mobile products· Contribute to the full development cycle: technical design, development, testing, experimentation, analysis, and release· Communicate with quality assurance and documentation to ensure application changes are well understood· Participate in iOS application development· Communicate status, progress, and issues to managementEssential Requirements· Experience building iOS mobile apps with Swift· Great communication skills.· Experience designing and developing against RESTful API’s· A pro-active approach with a creative eye and a ‘can do’ attitude.This is a 12-month contract with potential to become a permanent position based in our offices in Briarhill Business Park Galway. We offer a competitive salary and flexible working hours.If this spec appeals to you then we look forward to meeting with youJob Type: Full-timeSalary: €30,000.00-€35,000.00 per yearBenefits:Company eventsFlexitimeOn-site parkingSchedule:Monday to Friday At CGA Technology we are proud of every aspect of our company. Senior Front-end Developer - React, Dublin (Remote)
Optum, the fast-growing part of UnitedHealth Group, is a leading information and technology-enabled health services business. Our teams are dedicated to modernizing the health care system and improving the lives of people and communities.
Serving virtually every dimension of the health system, we work with a diverse set of clients across 150 countries – from those who diagnose and treat patients to those who pay for care, deliver health services, and those who supply the cures. Optum maintains operations across North America, South America, Europe, Asia Pacific and the Middle East. Our innovative partnerships provide technology and tools that enable unprecedented collaboration and efficiency. As a result, we can tap into valuable health care data to uncover insights and develop strategies for better care at lower costs.
About the role:
We are looking for an Experienced UI developer with a proven track record of delivering UI requirements into production to lead the design, implementation and delivery of new UI features on the Emisar Analytics Gateway product. You will work alongside the UX and Product team to design new UI components for the product. You will work as part of the existing agile development team to deliver these features and integrate them with the backend dependencies. Join us! There's never been a better time to do your life's best work℠
Primary Responsibilities:
Lead the design, implementation and delivery of new UI features on the Emisar Analytics Gateway product
Work alongside the UX and Product team to design new UI components for the product
Become part of an existing Agile development team
Delivering and integrating features with the backend dependencies
You will be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role, as well as providing development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
Strong demonstrable experience using front end development and production releases
TypeScript experience
Experience using React, React Hooks, Context API and Mobile responsive
Good communication skills across external stakeholders
Redux, Redux-Saga, Redux-Toolkit experience
Ability to work a portion of monthly work hours from our Dublin or Letterkenny office is required
Assets:
Cloud experience (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Experience using Jenkins
Docker experience
Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.
All telecommuters will be required to adhere to the UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy
Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Work at the forefront of automotive innovation with ZF,
one of the world’s leading automotive suppliers.
Mobile Software Engineer (m/f/d)
Location:
Dublin, IE, D02 AE12
Req ID 41947 Dublin, Ireland
ZF is a global technology company supplying systems for passenger cars, commercial vehicles and industrial technology, enabling the next generation of mobility. ZF allows vehicles to see, think and act. In the four technology domains of Vehicle Motion Control, Integrated Safety, Automated Driving, and Electric Mobility, ZF offers comprehensive product and software solutions for established vehicle manufacturers and newly emerging transport and mobility service providers. With its products and its more than 150,000 employees around the world, ZF contributes to reducing emissions, protecting the climate and enhancing safe mobility.

We are currently looking for skilled people that want to have an impact with their work to join a newly formed ZF Aftermarket Product Engineering team in our existing Dublin office. Over the next 12 months, this team will be working to bring a new customer-facing platform from concept to production through a deeply collaborative effort between our engineering, UX, Product and Data members. The team will leverage the company's existing knowledge of both the industry and technologies to create a digital product that will help reduce CO2 emissions of fleets, improve road safety and provide predictability and value to its customers. This is a unique opportunity to have an early and significant impact on shaping both the new engineering organization and product while having the security of being part of one of the world's largest automotive suppliers.

About the Mobile Software Engineer:
As a Mobile Software Engineer, you are part of a small highly skilled, innovative, and motivated development team working in an agile environment to quickly identify areas of the aftermarket industry that can be enhanced by digital solutions. You will work closely with the product team using cutting-edge technologies to build state-of-the-art Android/iOS applications and take care of the good integration of our back-end systems. In this role, you will be one of our earliest native mobile app developers working as part of small team of mobile app specialist to build complementary applications that are sympathetically designed to suit the native platform.

Your tasks:
You will create the team's native Android/iOS application with the support of Product and our UX team
Advocate native interface Guidelines and develop best practices
Shape the architecture of the application to ensure maintainability and testability
Work with partners to integrate services and equipment into the app (car connectivity, tire monitoring, etc.)
Write unit/integration tests as part of CICD pipelines

Your profile:
Computer Science degree or equivalent
5+ years of software development experience
Minimum 3 years of Android/iOS development experience
Familiar with JavaScript. Experience with React/React Native is preferred
Expertise in TDD
Experience with automated testing tools
Experience integrating connected devices on Android/iOS
Interest in understanding the industry and data available to us
Openness to trying new technologies and approaches

Why ZF in Dublin?
You will work in an open and transparent corporate culture where ownership, accountability, diversity and respect are important values. Our employees are passionate about their job and are all convinced that team spirit and fun are at the heart of our success. Our teamwork in an environment with healthy self-reflection and improvement ingrained in our approach, where outside ideas are genuinely valued, and every member can influence decisions or question current norms.
In this stimulating, fast-growing and challenging environment, we offer you:
Competitive compensation package that includes base salary, bonus scheme and benefits
24 days annual leave, 11 bank holidays (incl. Good Friday)
Pension scheme with up to 5% matching contribution
Comprehensive company health care scheme with Laya – including up to max. 500 EUR yearly refund for Routine Dental
Meaningful development and career opportunities
Flexible and hybrid work models

The position is part of the ZF Global Employee Referral Program.

Be part of our ZF team as Mobile Software Engineer (m/f/d) and apply now!
Contact
Elise Cosquer
+49 211 584 222 221
Our Commitment to Diversity
ZF is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

About the Mobile Software Engineer:
As a Mobile Software Engineer, you are part of a small highly skilled, innovative, and motivated development team working in an agile environment to quickly identify areas of the aftermarket industry that can be enhanced by digital solutions. You will work closely with the product team using cutting-edge technologies to build state-of-the-art Android/iOS applications and take care of the good integration of our back-end systems. In this role, you will be one of our earliest native mobile app developers working as part of small team of mobile app specialist to build complementary applications that are sympathetically designed to suit the native platform.

Your tasks:
You will create the team's native Android/iOS application with the support of Product and our UX team
Advocate native interface Guidelines and develop best practices
Shape the architecture of the application to ensure maintainability and testability
Work with partners to integrate services and equipment into the app (car connectivity, tire monitoring, etc.)
Write unit/integration tests as part of CICD pipelines

Your profile:
Computer Science degree or equivalent
5+ years of software development experience
Minimum 3 years of Android/iOS development experience
Familiar with JavaScript. Experience with React/React Native is preferred
Expertise in TDD
Experience with automated testing tools
Experience integrating connected devices on Android/iOS
Interest in understanding the industry and data available to us
Openness to trying new technologies and approaches

Why ZF in Dublin?
You will work in an open and transparent corporate culture where ownership, accountability, diversity and respect are important values. Our employees are passionate about their job and are all convinced that team spirit and fun are at the heart of our success. Mobile, iOS, Android, Junior, Developer

I am working with a multi-national Irish based company who are rapidly expanding their technology team in Ireland. They are looking for a Junior Mobile developer to join their team at an entry level, working alongside other juniors and being mentored by senior developers. You will be working on a range of products, helping to develop production level native mobile code.

The main focus of the growth is to improve user experience, with the applications constantly being updated - this will involve working closely alongside the design team throughout the process as well as maintaining product orientation. This is an opportunity for a junior developer to move into a growing mobile team, working alongside experienced developers.

What are they looking for?
Knowledge of iOS/Android platforms
Experience or Interest in Swift, Java
Knowledge of Agile frameworks
Relevant third level degree
Desirable:
Previous experience in a mobile role
Experience working commercially in a developer role
Experience with iOS, Android
Salary & Benefits:
Hybrid working
Pension

Comcast Business offers technology solutions ranging from Ethernet, internet, and WiFi connectivity to voice, television, and managed Enterprise solutions to power businesses of all sizes to perform better. From small businesses to mid-market and large Enterprise organizations, Comcast Business serves business customers across the country. Powered by an advanced, Gig-speed network and backed by 24/7 technical support, Comcast Business is one of the largest contributors to the growth of Comcast Cable. The organization is the nation’s largest cable provider to small and mid-size businesses and has emerged as a force in the Enterprise market, recognized by leading industry associations as one of the fastest growing provider of Ethernet services.
Job Summary
The Senior Python developer is a part of the multi-functional Blueface Technology Team and is instrumental in the full software development life-cycle. This includes, but is not limited to, requirement gathering, design and development through to deployment and post-release. The role has scope to evolve based on the candidate’s desire to learn and become involved in other technical fields. This position would have more experience and responsibility in ongoing projects than a standard back end developer.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Develop and test algorithms to solve complex business problems.
Design and build complex data to support new business initiatives.
Employ the latest techniques such as Agile Software Development.
Writing the web services and APIs used by developers and mobile application developers
Server-side web application logic as well as the integration of front-end part aspects
Preferred Skills:
Python proficiency is essential
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English
Git
Celery
Redis
Experience with RabbitMQ or another AMQP broker
Relational database systems. E.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL
Python web frameworks. eg Flask, Django
Python object-relational mapping libraries. eg sqlalchemy, storm
Agile Software Development (tools like Jira, etc)
Exceptional Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills
Proven Experience Developing for LINUX
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced development schedule
#blueface

Bachelor's Degree

Job Summary
The Senior Python developer is a part of the multi-functional Blueface Technology Team and is instrumental in the full software development life-cycle. This includes, but is not limited to, requirement gathering, design and development through to deployment and post-release. The role has scope to evolve based on the candidate’s desire to learn and become involved in other technical fields. This position would have more experience and responsibility in ongoing projects than a standard back end developer.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Develop and test algorithms to solve complex business problems.
Design and build complex data to support new business initiatives.
Employ the latest techniques such as Agile Software Development.
Writing the web services and APIs used by developers and mobile application developers
Server-side web application logic as well as the integration of front-end part aspects
Preferred Skills:
Python proficiency is essential
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English
Git
Celery
Redis
Experience with RabbitMQ or another AMQP broker
Relational database systems. E.g. MySQL, PostgreSQL
Python web frameworks. eg Flask, Django
Python object-relational mapping libraries. eg sqlalchemy, storm
Agile Software Development (tools like Jira, etc)
Exceptional Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills
Proven Experience Developing for LINUX
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced development schedule

Graduate Software developer - 60>70% remote working possible - Direct applicants only
8 West Consulting is one of the country’s largest software development organisations. The company has been operating successfully in Cork city since 1998. 8 West Consulting employ a wide range of technologies including Mobile (iOS, Android, Windows), Java SE/Java EE (WebLogic, WebSphere, Spring, Akka, Hibernate, GWT, etc.), Microsoft .NET (ASP.NET, C#, etc.), JavaScript (AngularJS, JQuery, dojo, etc.), various database management systems (MongoDB, Oracle, SQL Server, MySql, etc.). 8 West Consulting provides consultancy and leading edge software solutions for a wide variety of US, EU and UK based clients in the insurance, healthcare, retail and public sector markets.

For more on 8 West Consulting visit our website www.8west.ie
We are seeking energetic, driven Bachelor or Masters level graduate developers (class of 2021 or 2022 subject to course completion) for permanent positions at our development offices in Cork. These will be technically challenging and rewarding positions, on various client accounts, working on major n-tier enterprise applications. The roles will require interaction with other developers in the team, supports functions, and project management to develop robust, scalable, and highly performant systems. Good career progression opportunities attach to all 8 West roles.
Responsibilities

Requirements analysis & Application Design
Providing accurate estimates and timings to project managers
Delivery of application development using standard web development methodologies
Ensuring all QA procedures are satisfied in terms of process and documentation.

Technical Profile

Strong technical competence
Some knowledge and/or experience of Java and/or Net and C# or front end technologies

Personal Profile

We would like to receive applications from recent graduates from Masters programmes or Bachelor of Science (Software development or related) degrees
We need graduates who are articulate, confident, and self motivating
We particularly like people who share our passion for technology and software development
We prefer that you display excellent written and verbal English communication skills
You should be an innovative problem solver and should also have the ability to collaborate in a dynamic team environment
Candidates who apply must be eligible to work in Ireland holding either EU Citizenship or appropriate visa. Visa is required in advance of applying for this position. 8 West Consulting do not provide sponsorship for this role Graduate Software developer - 60>70% remote working possible - Direct applicants only

Company Description
We pledge "to prove IT can make a real difference to our customer's businesses". We work hard to ensure we understand what our customers need from their technology solutions and then we deliver.

We are an award-winning company who provide world class customer service; we think big and we hire great people. Version 1 are more than just another IT services company - we are leaders in implementing and supporting Oracle, Microsoft and AWS technologies.

Invest in us and we’ll invest in you; if you are driven, committed and up for a challenge, we want to meet you.

Job Description
Coding new developments and/or enhancements.
Design mobile applications, web applications, systems or processes.
Quality assures program specifications and code.
Create functional design documentation.
Adhere to code quality and unit testing standards
Identify and implement integration tests, automating tests where appropriate.
Investigate and manage complex Live Incidents.
Coordinate or escalate defects / problems.
Perform Root Cause Analysis.
Coordinate team or release activities.
Create and demonstrate prototypes/screen designs.
Supervise and coach junior resources.
Provide input to governance and status reports.

Qualifications

4+ years experience in programming mobile applications for IOS, Android and Hybrid.
Experience of building high-performing, scalable, enterprise-grade mobile applications.
Experience of Spring, JavaScript, Angular/AngularJS, Ionic, Typescript, SASS, Leaflet, Capacitor.
Experience of HTML, CSS, XML, & JSON.
Experience of developing webservices and Restful APIs.
Knowledge/experience of delivery methodologies, application development lifecycle, and delivery models.
Technical solution design skills to allow the analyst to determine the optimum solution using the correct blend of technologies to meet a set of defined requirements.
Additional Information
Before you apply, here are some of our benefits. We offer profit share, pension, private medical, flexible working policy and more. We offer incentives for accreditations and educational assistance for courses relevant to your role.
We offer employee recognition in the form of Excellence Awards and V1Ps which is awarded by your peers. Engagement is incredibly important with local engagement teams driving our engagement events! Company Description

We, in Ericsson, have been finding ways to communicate for over a century. We are committed to enabling new means of communication through our innovation and creativity. We are passionate about our responsibility to innovate not just for gain but also Technology for Good; from mobile communications to education for all.
The software we build in Product Development Unit OSS makes it possible for billions of people to connect with each other, surf the web, engage with social media on their smart devices every day. Exciting opportunities exist for cloud native developers, data scientists and Radio Access Network engineers within our R&D department to craft the future of the evolving Networked Society.
About this opportunity
In Product Development Unit OSS (Operations and Support Systems), our unit leads the development of Ericsson Intelligent Automation Platform (EIAP) and Automation Applications (rApps) that enable higher operational efficiency, improved network performance and better subscriber experience.
With EAIP we aim to enable an open ecosystem for innovation and development of rApps with a short lead time from idea to prototype and production.
We are building an innovation team of self-starters, that can talk Radio with customers, work wonders with data and rapidly develop prototype ideas. We are looking for Engineers for this team that will engage with product managers and customers, understand their automation needs and develop rApp prototypes to fulfil such needs.
What you will do
Build rApp prototypes
Participate in rApp prototyping engagements with customers.
Explore innovative automation technologies and solutions.
You will bring some of
A genuine interest and good understanding of RAN technologies
An understanding of CSPs Network Management and RAN Automation needs
Experience of data engineering and data modelling
Experience with software development and good systemization skills
A passion to innovate and build something new
What do we offer?
We support all forms of workplace environments, from using the office as a full or part time workspace with remote working within Ireland
A healthy work-life balance (flexible hours, maternity/paternity and parental leave)
27 days annual leave, family-friendly work environment!
Multifaceted sports and social club which hosts many sporting (e.g. golf, football, swimming, tennis) and social (e.g. gaming, theatre, movie, nights out) activities
Expand your horizons in a rich multicultural environment
Clearly defined career paths, improved with inhouse training and financial support for external study
Opportunities to travel around the world and work directly with our customers
Pension scheme, health insurance, company doctor, life cover and sick pay/income continuance plan
Tax saver commuter/bike to work scheme
Why join Ericsson?
At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
What happens once you apply?
Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

Ericsson complies with applicable country, state and all local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location across the world in which the company has facilities. In addition, Ericsson supports the UN Guiding Principles for Business and Human Rights and the United Nations Global Compact.

We, in Ericsson, have been finding ways to communicate for over a century. We are committed to enabling new means of communication through our innovation and creativity. We are passionate about our responsibility to innovate not just for gain but also Technology for Good; from mobile communications to education for all.
The software we build in Product Development Unit OSS makes it possible for billions of people to connect with each other, surf the web, engage with social media on their smart devices every day. Exciting opportunities exist for cloud native developers, data scientists and Radio Access Network engineers within our R&D department to craft the future of the evolving Networked Society.
About this opportunity
In Product Development Unit OSS (Operations and Support Systems), our unit leads the development of Ericsson Intelligent Automation Platform (EIAP) and Automation Applications (rApps) that enable higher operational efficiency, improved network performance and better subscriber experience.
With EAIP we aim to enable an open ecosystem for innovation and development of rApps with a short lead time from idea to prototype and production.
We are building an innovation team of self-starters, that can talk Radio with customers, work wonders with data and rapidly develop prototype ideas. We are looking for Engineers for this team that will engage with product managers and customers, understand their automation needs and develop rApp prototypes to fulfil such needs.
What you will do
Build rApp prototypes
Participate in rApp prototyping engagements with customers.
Explore innovative automation technologies and solutions.
You will bring some of
A genuine interest and good understanding of RAN technologies
An understanding of CSPs Network Management and RAN Automation needs
Experience of data engineering and data modelling
Experience with software development and good systemization skills
A passion to innovate and build something new
What do we offer?
We support all forms of workplace environments, from using the office as a full or part time workspace with remote working within Ireland
A healthy work-life balance (flexible hours, maternity/paternity and parental leave)
27 days annual leave, family-friendly work environment!
Multifaceted sports and social club which hosts many sporting (e.g. golf, football, swimming, tennis) and social (e.g. gaming, theatre, movie, nights out) activities
Expand your horizons in a rich multicultural environment
Clearly defined career paths, improved with inhouse training and financial support for external study
Opportunities to travel around the world and work directly with our customers
Pension scheme, health insurance, company doctor, life cover and sick pay/income continuance plan
Tax saver commuter/bike to work scheme
Why join Ericsson?
At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
What happens once you apply?
Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

Ericsson complies with applicable country, state and all local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location across the world in which the company has facilities. Junior Mobile App Developer
Dublin, Ireland
Role
Diona provide a suite of native mobile applications (iOS, Android and Windows 10) for government agencies. Diona’s self service solutions are used by citizens to apply for and receive benefits from government agencies. Diona’s case worker solutions enable agency workers to engage with families and children in their homes. Our software has won multiple awards and has an average rating of 4.6 – 4.7 in the app stores.
Your role will be to work as a member of the Diona product development team. You will play a part in the maintenance of our existing solutions and the development of new solutions. You will be actively encouraged to participate in the development of our solutions on all platforms.
Responsibilities
Designing and maintaining Diona’s suite of mobile apps
Translate business requirements into technical solutions
Contribute to the full development cycle: technical design, development, testing, experimentation, analysis, and release
Deliver high quality software and provide support to our QA team
Contribute to planning and prioritisation of development activities and provide technical estimates
Developing automated user interaction tests
Skills & Attributes
Mostly, we value intelligence, personality and attitude. However, the following will also help:
1-2 years’ experience in IT
Experience building iOS mobile apps with Objective-C
Experience building Android mobile apps using the Android SDK with Java or Kotlin
Some knowledge of Java
Experience using Appium or another automated test platform
Passion for developing scalable, well-designed software that people love and that helps people in need
Great communication skills. You must be able to collaborate effectively and discuss complex topics with technical and non-technical audiences.
Experience designing and developing against RESTful API’s
For consideration, please send your CV to joinus@diona.com and reference Dublin in the subject line. Thank you for your interest in Diona! Junior Mobile App Developer

Digital Health Technology team powers digital experiences and engagement to enhance the lives of millions of people every day through connected care. We build, deliver and manage a portfolio of data management platforms and mobile offerings in support of our core businesses. We thrive on simple and elegant architecture and agility. You’ll be immersed in a dynamic high-growth environment and empowered to excel, take informed risks, and drive ingenuity across the enterprise.
Let’s talk about the team and you:
As an Android developer, you will be a part of a highly dynamic and innovative development team working on the latest technologies in the exciting fast growing Digital Health space. We’re a team of thinkers and innovators who constantly challenge ourselves to do everything better than the day before, so that people around the world can breathe easier.
You will be part of a full stack team of mobile (iOS and Android) and cloud (AWS) engineers and be responsible for delivering the best-in-class patient product experience, all built using the latest tech stacks in Kotlin on Android. You will work closely with talented engineers, product managers, customers, architects, and various stakeholders to deliver our best in class mobile applications.
Let's talk about responsibilities:
Responsible for developing our best in class Android applications
Collaborate with other engineers and product owners to identify best in class software solutions to complex problems in our industry
Take a quality-first approach to software development by producing unit tests and automate functional testing as much as possible
Conduct code reviews with other developers, including security checks
Participate in technical interviews
Let's talk about qualification and experience:
You must be a passionate Android developer, with at least 2-3 years of mobile development experience
Hands on experience developing apps in Kotlin for at least 2 years
Experience designing and architecting Android apps and understand various design patterns
Experience with use of Continuous Integration and automated testing frameworks
Portfolio of apps in Google Play store as reference work
Experience working with peripherals/wearables and Bluetooth is desirable.
Master’s Degree in Computer Science or related discipline.
With a 30-year history of innovation as a global leader in health technology, at ResMed we know that good ideas can come from anywhere. Innovation and imagination aren’t just something we aspire to; they are integral to the way we work. We work hard to provide the opportunity for every employee to do amazing things every day as we shape the future together. Come play!
Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now! Job Title:
Game Tester - Italian Localization/QA - Activision Games
Requisition ID:
R009807
Job Description:
Activision is currently recruiting for Localisation QA Testers to test Call of Duty and other Activision Games.
All positions are fixed term, full time hours (35 hours)
Contract duration may vary (6 months +) with an opportunity for extension
Various Shifts available (Mon-Fri or 4 days on 4 days off)
This is a phenomenal time to Activision. Ask anyone who works at Activision, or with Activision, their favourite thing about it, and they’ll tell you, it’s the people. We are nothing without our employee’s brilliance.
We have world class brands, infrastructure and resources, but our success doesn’t come from assembly lines producing widgets. Our success comes from people producing greatness together.
Activision is more than just the top tier developer and publisher of video games; we are the creators of some of the biggest, most ground-breaking titles in the industry. Our portfolio includes Call of Duty®, Crash Bandicoot™, and Spyro.
Your Platform
Localisation Dublin was established in 2007 and is located 2.3km from Dublin City Centre in East Point Business Park. As a team we handle the Project Management and Quality Assurance of our phenomenal games from English to 14 different languages globally. Our purpose is to ensure that the localised version of a game meets the highest quality standards before being released. At our location you can expect to work with colleagues from all across the world.
Your Mission
Test each project assigned to identify localisation and functional bugs.
Review language components (e.g. Text & Audio files) before integration.
Identify and detail defects in a clear and concise manner using the designated bug tracking database
Complete regression/verification testing daily.
Provide ad-hoc translations.
Other duties assigned as the need arises
Player Profile
Knowledge & Skills
Fluent or Bilingual language skills in Italian
Good level of written and spoken English
Enjoy playing video games on a variety of platforms including PC, Console and Mobile
Experience
Previous experience in QA or a linguistic role is a plus – but not required as you will get full training
Second level education (High School) or equivalent is required
Third level education in languages a distinct advantage
Key Attributes
Adaptability & Flexibility
Eagerness to Learn
Teamwork
Analytical Skills
Benefits & Perks
Finishing bonus: You may be eligible to receive a bonus payment should you stay with us until the end of your contract.
Annual leave: 5 Weeks (pro-rated)
Paid Health Insurance
Commuter Tickets – Public Transport Taxsaver & Bike 2 Work purchase incentives
Free & Discounted Games and Merchandise on Employee Store for Activision, Blizzard & King
Our World
Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!
Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!
The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.
Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
Accommodation Request
We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to accommodationrequests@activisionblizzard.com. Job Title:

Our purpose is to ensure that the localised version of a game meets the highest quality standards before being released. At our location you can expect to work with colleagues from all across the world.
Your Mission
Test each project assigned to identify localisation and functional bugs.
Review language components (e.g. Text & Audio files) before integration.
Identify and detail defects in a clear and concise manner using the designated bug tracking database
Complete regression/verification testing daily.
Provide ad-hoc translations.
Other duties assigned as the need arises
Player Profile
Knowledge & Skills
Fluent or Bilingual language skills in Italian
Good level of written and spoken English
Enjoy playing video games on a variety of platforms including PC, Console and Mobile
Experience
Previous experience in QA or a linguistic role is a plus – but not required as you will get full training
Second level education (High School) or equivalent is required
Third level education in languages a distinct advantage
Key Attributes
Adaptability & Flexibility
Eagerness to Learn
Teamwork
Analytical Skills
Benefits & Perks
Finishing bonus: You may be eligible to receive a bonus payment should you stay with us until the end of your contract.
Annual leave: 5 Weeks (pro-rated)
Paid Health Insurance
Commuter Tickets – Public Transport Taxsaver & Bike 2 Work purchase incentives
Free & Discounted Games and Merchandise on Employee Store for Activision, Blizzard & King
Our World
Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!
Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!
The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.
Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
Accommodation Request
We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to accommodationrequests@activisionblizzard.com. Job Title: 
Requisition ID:

Our client are looking for a Mobile App Developer who is a dynamic, skilful and enthusiastic person to join their Software Development team. The Mobile App Developer will take ownership for their work, is committed to building high quality, extensible code and who has experience working within an agile software development team is the ideal.

What is Expected of the Mobile App Developer:
Working with the product team to develop new features for iOS and Android applications

Maintaining the existing applications and resolving issues that arise

Enthusiasm for new challenges

What is required for the Mobile App Developer:
3+ years of profession experience of building and maintaining Android mobile applications is required

Experience releasing applications on the at least one of the App stores

Excellent communication and teamwork skills

Experience with version control, ideally Git

Bachelor’s degree in computer science or similar

Desirable

Experience with Swift and iOS development

Experience with Unit Testing

Experience in Agile environment

Druid’s software is widely deployed in Europe delivering enhanced mobile services and unified communications solutions to businesses where employees require mobility. The vertical segments which Druid addresses include: Healthcare, Universities, Airports & Security. In 2019, Druid Software built upon its 4G and 5G platforms.Druid focuses heavily on employee training, development and retention. Blueface is a Comcast Business technology company specializing in unified communications as a service to carriers and businesses of any size, anywhere in the world. Based in Dublin, Ireland, Blueface began in 2004 with a mission to change how businesses communicate globally. Comcast Corporation is a global media and technology company with three primary businesses: Comcast Cable, NBCUniversal, and Sky. Blueface has a global reach with headquarters in Dublin, Ireland and Philadelphia, USA; with additional offices in New York, Rome, and Madrid. As a member of Comcast Business, Blueface’s culture is built on integrity and respect—with the goal of working together to drive ourselves and our businesses to always be creative, innovative, and competitive. At Blueface, we embrace good ideas and bring them to life quickly. We’re forward-looking and restless in looking for new ways to innovate for our customers.
Job Summary
This person reports to the Mobile Framework Development Manager and their function within the organisation includes Software Design, Software Development and Software Support. They will design and build the application for mobile devices running through the Android operating software. They will be responsible for designing and coding the base application, ensuring the quality of the application, fixing bugs, maining code and implementing updates.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Assist in development and implementation of overall work plan for the Mobile Framework Development team. Achieve successful delivery of projects, while balancing functionality, quality and schedule.
Work closely with internal teams and strategic vendors to provide and obtain technical and engineering information, adopting a partnership approach to maximize benefit to Blueface.
Maintain and develop your own experience and knowledge base to ensure highest possible standards.
Assist in training and development of other staff members on both a formal and informal basis.
You will work closely with other members of the Technical and Engineering team to drive the technology innovation of Blueface.
Evaluate performance reports where required.
Create on-going quality control or process documentation in order to meet the requirements of audits and/or assessments
Develop and document best practice standards within the Mobile Framework Development team
Provide detailed and regular reports to the Mobile Framework Development Manager
Requirements:
Android JetPack
RxJava
Java proficiency is essential
Experience using and creating RESTful APIs (JSON & XML)
Agile Software Development
Jira suite
Unit Testing
Exceptional Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced development schedule
Ability to work with git
Employees at all levels are expected to:
Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.
#blueface
Disclaimer:
This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications.
Education
Bachelor's Degree
While possessing the stated degree is preferred, Comcast also may consider applicants who hold some combination of coursework and experience, or who have extensive related professional experience.
Certifications (if applicable)
Relative Work Experience
2-5 Years

We will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law. ConnectIT Software provides financial management software to the construction Industry in both the UK and Ireland, and in particular working with companies for whom management of plant & equipment is a significant source of cost or revenue. We provide state of the art financial management solutions with emphasis on plant and equipment rental, cost, maintenance and asset management applications.
Background
Prominent in our development roadmap is the “Mobilisation” and further “Penetration” of the industry’s proven best practice workflow of several outreaching aspects of our applications such as:
Procurement
Maintenance Management
Transport & Logistics
Diarised Workflow
CRM
Payroll

Position
The position, reporting to the management team and development mentors, is to take a pivotal hands on role in the mobilisation of these applications through a process of technology evaluation, application deployment R+D and prototype evaluation before committing to delivery based projects.
Training
Product and Technical Training Program will be provided.
Key Requirements
The ideal applicant will be a motivated self starter with the right combination of practical experience and “can do” outlook.
Experience or the ability to demonstrate an understanding of the issues involved in mobile deployment of application(s) whereby data is value added between back office server applications and mobilised workflow steps.
We use Four Js Genero and IBM Informix database. Genero is a feature rich 360® Cross Platform Development Framework which provides a full Studio IDE to support Rapid Application Development for Server, desktop, Mobile and Report Writing. Genero supports all major relational database engines. Experience of delivering applications using 4GL/RAD tools and RDBMS is a requirement.
An appreciation of the construction industry would be advantageous.
How To Apply
If you’re interested in applying for the above position, please submit your application via email. You must clearly identify which position you are applying for and please ensure you have attached your CV.
Please allow two weeks for responses following your application. job_title: Account Manager, Mobile Gaming, EMEA Gaming Mid-Market
listing_jobDesc:
The Meta Global Gaming team’s mission is to be the partner of choice for developers to grow and monetize their apps, on and off Meta’s platforms. Within the global industry, the EMEA region represents one of the most robust gaming ecosystems and the momentum of EMEA gaming companies in the worldwide market is only accelerating forward. Our team’s aspiration is to play an increasingly pivotal role in helping this community of game developers and publishers realize their global ambitions. Meta is seeking an Account Manager to help our Mobile Gaming clients get the best results from their marketing campaigns on Meta – through consultation, education, optimization, and support. Success in this position requires rigorous account planning and exceptional consultative sales skills; a keen eye for identifying process and workflow improvement opportunities; the ability to thrive in a dynamic, team-focused environment; and a passion for helping others achieve results. This position will be responsible for working with other teams across Meta to create and grow programs focused on improving the Meta experience for our clients. This position is based in our Dublin office supporting our EMEA business.

Account Manager, Mobile Gaming, EMEA Gaming Mid-Market Responsibilities:

Build and manage relationships with clients and develop a thorough understanding of their business objectives, goals and challenges
Rapidly build influence with C-level stakeholders to understand their vision, strategy, and game pipeline potential
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to scope out business opportunities and to deliver results (i.e. facilitating plans & recommendations from such teams as marketing science, creative shop, product through to implementation)
Become an expert in Meta’s solutions for businesses of all sizes and adapt recommendations quickly to suit varying client needs
Use data and insights to guide strategy and implementation of Meta solutions against client's marketing objectives
Educate clients on Meta solutions and provide consultative support on their media, measurement, and creative strategy to grow existing partnerships
Work directly with advertisers to improve their advertising campaign performance, troubleshoot and resolve account issues in a timely manner
Identify and pursue opportunities, prioritize accounts, handle objections and evaluate campaign effectiveness
Gather advertiser feedback to enhance current and future ad products
Flawless management of internal account operations (revenue delivery, media recommendations, troubleshooting issues, optimization opportunities)

Minimum Qualifications:

Analytical, critical-thinking, strategy development and creative problem-solving abilities
Strong problem solving and quantitative analytical skills
Typically 4+ years of advertising experience
Ability to effectively prioritize and manage tasks within a fast-paced environment while maintaining strict attention to detail
Excellent communication skills, native oral and written fluency in English & one other EMEA based language, ideally Turkish The Meta Global Gaming team’s mission is to be the partner of choice for developers to grow and monetize their apps, on and off Meta’s platforms. Within the global industry, the EMEA region represents one of the most robust gaming ecosystems and the momentum of EMEA gaming companies in the worldwide market is only accelerating forward. Our team’s aspiration is to play an increasingly pivotal role in helping this community of game developers and publishers realize their global ambitions. Meta is seeking an Account Manager to help our Mobile Gaming clients get the best results from their marketing campaigns on Meta – through consultation, education, optimization, and support. Success in this position requires rigorous account planning and exceptional consultative sales skills; a keen eye for identifying process and workflow improvement opportunities; the ability to thrive in a dynamic, team-focused environment; and a passion for helping others achieve results. This position will be responsible for working with other teams across Meta to create and grow programs focused on improving the Meta experience for our clients. This position is based in our Dublin office supporting our EMEA business.

Account Manager, Mobile Gaming, EMEA Gaming Mid-Market Responsibilities:

Build and manage relationships with clients and develop a thorough understanding of their business objectives, goals and challenges
Rapidly build influence with C-level stakeholders to understand their vision, strategy, and game pipeline potential
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to scope out business opportunities and to deliver results (i.e. facilitating plans & recommendations from such teams as marketing science, creative shop, product through to implementation)
Become an expert in Meta’s solutions for businesses of all sizes and adapt recommendations quickly to suit varying client needs
Use data and insights to guide strategy and implementation of Meta solutions against client's marketing objectives
Educate clients on Meta solutions and provide consultative support on their media, measurement, and creative strategy to grow existing partnerships
Work directly with advertisers to improve their advertising campaign performance, troubleshoot and resolve account issues in a timely manner
Identify and pursue opportunities, prioritize accounts, handle objections and evaluate campaign effectiveness
Gather advertiser feedback to enhance current and future ad products
Flawless management of internal account operations (revenue delivery, media recommendations, troubleshooting issues, optimization opportunities)

Minimum Qualifications:

Analytical, critical-thinking, strategy development and creative problem-solving abilities
Strong problem solving and quantitative analytical skills
Typically 4+ years of advertising experience
Ability to effectively prioritize and manage tasks within a fast-paced environment while maintaining strict attention to detail

Work at the forefront of automotive innovation with ZF,
one of the world’s leading automotive suppliers.
Frontend Developer (m/f/d)
Location:
Dublin, IE, D02 AE12
Req ID 41644 Dublin, Ireland
ZF is a global technology company supplying systems for passenger cars, commercial vehicles and industrial technology, enabling the next generation of mobility. ZF allows vehicles to see, think and act. In the four technology domains of Vehicle Motion Control, Integrated Safety, Automated Driving, and Electric Mobility, ZF offers comprehensive product and software solutions for established vehicle manufacturers and newly emerging transport and mobility service providers. With its products and its more than 150,000 employees around the world, ZF contributes to reducing emissions, protecting the climate and enhancing safe mobility.

We are currently looking for skilled people that want to have an impact with their work to join a newly formed ZF Aftermarket Product Engineering team in our existing Dublin office. Over the next 12 months, this team will be working to bring a new customer-facing platform from concept to production through a deeply collaborative effort between our engineering, UX, Product and Data members. The team will leverage the company's existing knowledge of both the industry and technologies to create a digital product that will help reduce CO2 emissions of fleets, improve road safety and provide predictability and value to its customers. This is a unique opportunity to have an early and significant impact on shaping both the new engineering organization and product while having the security of being part of one of the world's largest automotive suppliers.

About the Front-End Developer:
As a Front-End developer you be part of a small highly skilled, innovative and motivated development team in the construction and exploitation of new digital solutions for fleets, developed using cutting-edge technologies in web application and cloud computing. You will be working closely with the product team and senior Front-End developers, to build responsive, data-centric rich web applications, using the latest JavaScript frameworks. You must possess a flair for User Experience and a passion for producing state-of-the-art user interfaces

Your tasks:
Designing and building applications based on React
Provide Technical Leadership toward best practices and patterns when working with React
Work closely with Product and the team's UX designer to build products from proof of concept through to production.
Building high-performance responsive applications
Write unit/integration tests as part of CICD pipelines

Your profile:
Computer Science degree or equivalent
5+ years of software development experience
Strong proficiency in JavaScript & CSS
Working knowledge of CI/CD pipelines in GitLab/GitHub
Expertise in TDD, Jest or React testing libraries is advantageous.
Experience with client automation tools
Working with the full stack
Interest/experience with Mobile is a plus
Interest in understanding the industry and data available to us
Openness to trying new technologies and approaches

Why ZF in Dublin?
You will work in an open and transparent corporate culture where ownership, accountability, diversity and respect are important values. Our employees are passionate about their job and are all convinced that team spirit and fun are at the heart of our success. Our teamwork in an environment with healthy self-reflection and improvement ingrained in our approach, where outside ideas are genuinely valued, and every member can influence decisions or question current norms.

In this stimulating, fast-growing and challenging environment, we offer you:
Competitive compensation package that includes base salary, bonus scheme and benefits
24 days annual leave, 11 bank holidays (incl. Good Friday)
Pension scheme with up to 5% matching contribution
Comprehensive company health care scheme with Laya – including up to max. 500 EUR yearly refund for Routine Dental
Meaningful development and career opportunities
Flexible and hybrid work models

The position is part of the ZF Global Employee Referral Program.

Be part of our ZF team as Frontend Developer (m/f/d) and apply now!

This role will involve working on a wide variety of web and mobile projects for clients ranging from small business and NGOs to enterprise size organisations. You will be reporting to our Senior Development manager. Professional experience is desired but is not essential if you can provide evidence of appropriate educational qualifications and projects you have worked on.

Skills required / desired:

– PHP development experience, particularly with WordPress, Laravel and CodeIgniter.
– Android Native app development experience (Kotlin experience a plus).
– Front end development experience, particularly with VueJS.
– TDD experience a huge plus.

Ideally we would like to see some of your code so please give us access to a Git repository or sample of code you’ve worked on.

We are located in Dublin city centre close to Luas, Dart, Irish Rail and Dublin Bikes services.

Please send CVs to jobs@fusio.net – we’re looking forward to hearing from you

We are located in Dublin city centre close to Luas, Dart, Irish Rail and Dublin Bikes services.

Please send CVs to jobs@fusio.net – we’re looking forward to hearing from you

No agency calls please. Show more

Blueface is a Comcast Business technology company specializing in unified communications as a service to carriers and businesses of any size, anywhere in the world. Based in Dublin, Ireland, Blueface began in 2004 with a mission to change how businesses communicate globally. Comcast Corporation is a global media and technology company with three primary businesses: Comcast Cable, NBCUniversal, and Sky. Blueface has a global reach with headquarters in Dublin, Ireland and Philadelphia, USA; with additional offices in New York, Rome, and Madrid. As a member of Comcast Business, Blueface’s culture is built on integrity and respect—with the goal of working together to drive ourselves and our businesses to always be creative, innovative, and competitive. At Blueface, we embrace good ideas and bring them to life quickly. We’re forward-looking and restless in looking for new ways to innovate for our customers.
Job Summary
This person reports to the Mobile Framework Development Manager and their function within the organisation includes Software Design, Software Development and Software Support. They will design and build the application for mobile devices running through the Android operating software. They will be responsible for designing and coding the base application, ensuring the quality of the application, fixing bugs, maining code and implementing updates.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Assist in development and implementation of overall work plan for the Mobile Framework Development team. Achieve successful delivery of projects, while balancing functionality, quality and schedule.
Work closely with internal teams and strategic vendors to provide and obtain technical and engineering information, adopting a partnership approach to maximize benefit to Blueface.
Maintain and develop your own experience and knowledge base to ensure highest possible standards.
Assist in training and development of other staff members on both a formal and informal basis.
You will work closely with other members of the Technical and Engineering team to drive the technology innovation of Blueface.
Evaluate performance reports where required.
Create on-going quality control or process documentation in order to meet the requirements of audits and/or assessments
Develop and document best practice standards within the Mobile Framework Development team
Provide detailed and regular reports to the Mobile Framework Development Manager
Requirements:
Android JetPack
RxJava
Java proficiency is essential
Experience using and creating RESTful APIs (JSON & XML)
Agile Software Development
Jira suite
Unit Testing
Exceptional Analytical and Problem-Solving Skills
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced development schedule
Ability to work with git
Employees at all levels are expected to:
Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.
#blueface
Disclaimer:
This information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications.
Education
Bachelor's Degree
While possessing the stated degree is preferred, Comcast also may consider applicants who hold some combination of coursework and experience, or who have extensive related professional experience.
Certifications (if applicable)
Relative Work Experience
2-5 Years
Comcast is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law. Company Description
TrustMeUp is a social impact platform that offers technological solutions for various fundraising challenges nonprofits have. It provides an innovative loyalty solution with commercial perks for donors and an all-in-one management platform for nonprofits. It also offers APIs for merchants to connect to donate by shopping and similar functionalities.

Job Description
We are looking for a Senior-Level Front-end Developer with a passion for building beautiful, mobile-friendly products.
You are going to work in an open-minded, outcome-oriented and helpful team. As a Front-end developer, you will need to work with Product Managers, UX/UI Designers as well as Back-end developers, so being a good communicator and collaborator is an important aspect for this role. You are also expected to attend pre-scheduled online meetings. You'll also take a part on estimating future tasks and be responsible to deliver on the defined time frame.
Responsibilities:
Implementing the features and user interfaces according to the design
Develop efficient and reusable front-end systems
Meeting acceptance criteria and keeping test coverage high
Collaborate with Product Designers, Product Managers, and Software Engineers
Working harmoniously in a team, respecting the team members

Qualifications
Good understanding of Javascript and the ecosystem
Proficiency in React
HTML/CSS experience, including emotion styled
Experience with Rest APIs
GraphQL experience
Experience with test tools Jest and Cypress experience is a
plus
Storybook experience
Knowledge of Amazon Web Services hosting
Understanding of startup-based demands such as presentations, reviews, and pivots.
Proficient in English
Additional Information
We are looking for a motivated, curious, creative person, with good analysis and synthesis skills, priority management, multitasking skills, good interpersonal and teamwork skills, aptitude for problem solving and passion for the digital world and technological innovation.
We offer a continuous professional growth program within an innovative structure and remuneration of certain interest for the most qualified candidates. We are open to evaluate full-time and contract positions.
The research is aimed at people of both genders.
When submitting please indicate the authorization for the processing of personal data pursuant to EU GDPR rules. Company Description

job_title: Account Manager, Mobile Gaming, EMEA Gaming Mid-Market
listing_jobDesc:
The Meta Global Gaming team’s mission is to be the partner of choice for developers to grow and monetize their apps, on and off Meta’s platforms. Within the global industry, the EMEA region represents one of the most robust gaming ecosystems and the momentum of EMEA gaming companies in the worldwide market is only accelerating forward. Our team’s aspiration is to play an increasingly pivotal role in helping this community of game developers and publishers realize their global ambitions. Meta is seeking an Account Manager to help our Mobile Gaming clients get the best results from their marketing campaigns on Meta – through consultation, education, optimization, and support. Success in this position requires rigorous account planning and exceptional consultative sales skills; a keen eye for identifying process and workflow improvement opportunities; the ability to thrive in a dynamic, team-focused environment; and a passion for helping others achieve results. This position will be responsible for working with other teams across Meta to create and grow programs focused on improving the Meta experience for our clients. This position is based in our Dublin office supporting our EMEA business.

Account Manager, Mobile Gaming, EMEA Gaming Mid-Market Responsibilities:

Build and manage relationships with clients and develop a thorough understanding of their business objectives, goals and challenges
Rapidly build influence with C-level stakeholders to understand their vision, strategy, and game pipeline potential
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to scope out business opportunities and to deliver results (i.e. facilitating plans & recommendations from such teams as marketing science, creative shop, product through to implementation)
Become an expert in Meta’s solutions for businesses of all sizes and adapt recommendations quickly to suit varying client needs
Use data and insights to guide strategy and implementation of Meta solutions against client's marketing objectives
Educate clients on Meta solutions and provide consultative support on their media, measurement, and creative strategy to grow existing partnerships
Work directly with advertisers to improve their advertising campaign performance, troubleshoot and resolve account issues in a timely manner
Identify and pursue opportunities, prioritize accounts, handle objections and evaluate campaign effectiveness
Gather advertiser feedback to enhance current and future ad products
Flawless management of internal account operations (revenue delivery, media recommendations, troubleshooting issues, optimization opportunities)

Minimum Qualifications:

Analytical, critical-thinking, strategy development and creative problem-solving abilities
Strong problem solving and quantitative analytical skills
Typically 4+ years of advertising experience
Ability to effectively prioritize and manage tasks within a fast-paced environment while maintaining strict attention to detail
Excellent communication skills, native oral and written fluency in English & one other EMEA based language, ideally Turkish The Meta Global Gaming team’s mission is to be the partner of choice for developers to grow and monetize their apps, on and off Meta’s platforms. Desired Skills
Mobile, Frontend, iOS, Swift, Objective-C, Senior, Android

I am currently recruiting for a Senior Mobile Developer with expertise in iOS. My client are one of Ireland's largest software development organisations and they are looking to take on an experienced senior developer for a 12 month contract.

This contract position is fully remote and initially for 12 months, but with the potential to roll.

Skills Required:
5+ years' experience with iOS
Experience and Knowledge working with Swift5 and iOS SDKs
Experience working with APIs internal and external
Experience with RESTful APIs to connect applications to back-end services
Familiar with Objective-C
