Java/Scala Engineer - Dublin based - Hybrid approach to WFH and office based working


What can I expect from the Role?

We are building a development function to continuously improve, extend or replace the existing stack of applications and systems under the ownership of the Trading Tribe at PPB. Projects undertaken by this group will be many and varied and will mean that in joining this team you will gain exposure to a wide variety of applications, development approaches and technologies. We have an opportunity to look at our existing estate and to find ways to add value through optimising, automating, re-architecting and through the addition of new features and creation of new platforms where necessary.

We use Scala and Java where appropriate to build our platforms, and are focused on using the right technology for each task.


Is this you?
You have experience using agile and lean practices to deliver world class software. You are a Kaizen creature who never stops thinking about how to improve yourself and your team.

When hardware fails, your applications keep going because they are fault tolerant. When the company grows, your applications scale right alongside. Customers enjoy using your applications, because they are reactive and always perform well.

You understand that building the ‘right thing' is as important as building the ‘thing right', and have leveraged test-driven techniques such as ATDD to achieve both. You believe that software quality is the responsibility of the whole team, regardless of job titles.

You understand and embrace the philosophy of Continuous Delivery. You have no interest in throwing your work ‘over the wall' to anybody. Instead, you passionately believe in an agile, DevOps-centric team that builds, tests, releases and operates its own applications.


What are the experiences & Qualifications Required?

Experience as a Java or Scala programmer
An understanding of Event-driven, messaging-based systems
Messaging brokering technologies (experience in RabbitMQ and/or Kafka an advantage)
Dependency Injection (experience in Spring an advantage)
Storage technologies (SQL and/or NoSQL)
Test-driven development techniques (e.g. BDD and ATDD)
Automated testing and mocking techniques
Clean coding
Agile and Lean approaches


Who are we?

Paddy Power Betfair is an international sports betting and gaming operator, with a market-leading presence in the UK and Ireland, as well as a range of operations across Europe including Romania, Portugal and Malta.

We are online-led, mobile-led and sports-led: and our proprietary technology, unique products and innovative marketing all combine to offer a superb experience to our five million customers worldwide.

Our spirit, talent and ambition has taken us into the FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange and we now employ over 7,000 people in sixteen locations across the globe; from Dublin to Los Angeles, and London to Melbourne. Our culture rewards innovation, teamwork and we like to stay fast-moving in a dynamic industry.


ON A LARGER SCALE

We are part of Flutter Entertainment, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider for over thirteen million customers worldwide.

Established in 2019, Flutter merged with The Stars Group in 2020. As the parent company Flutter Entertainment now has a host of brands that sit under it including Paddy Power and Betfair (PPB), Sky Betting and Gaming, PokerStars, Timeform, OddsChecker, Sporting Life, SportsBet (in Australia), FOX Bet, TVG and FanDuel in the US.

Across the globe, Flutter employs over 14,000 people across more than 40 offices and over 600 retail sites. We pride ourselves on being a responsible operator, committed to making a positive contribution to the communities we operate within.


WHAT IS OUR CHALLENGE?

We deliver products at scale for over 5 million customers, 99,9% of transactions in less than a second
The products you'll develop will comply with ambitious uptime targets: less than 50 minutes downtime expected per year
Our systems process more than 7 million transactions every day (more than all the European stock exchanges combined)
We deliver high transitional products, serving more than 2.5Bn calls a day
We have a diverse and up to date technical landscape to explore, leverage and innovate on


What sort of benefits can I expect?

The Fun Stuff
Bonus scheme
Flexible working hours and working from home options
Uncapped Holiday Allowance (yes, you heard right)
Health and well being with free classes (yoga, bootcamp, swimming etc.)
Ministry of Fun who organise cool events throughout the year, like Bingo Loco
Career Progression
Global Mobility across all locations

The Boring Stuff
Pension Scheme
Subsidised Canteen
Life Insurance
Health Insurance
Access to thousands of online courses

At intive we innovate through design and engineering to create people-centric digital products. We are more than 3000 people with a passion for digital, who partner with the world’s leading brands such as Dow Jones, FOX, Warner Bros., Verizon, Macmillan, Facebook, Google, BMW, BlackBerry, Discovery, and more.
Our clients come to us to solve their biggest and the most complex business and technology challenges. We have over 20 years of experience working with companies across many industries, including Media & Entertainment, EdTech, Telecommunications, Retail, Automotive, FinTech, and Transportation.
Have you ever considered relocating to Ireland to be part of the Irish tech revolution? If so, Intive would love to speak with you!
We're currently seeking strong, Senior Android Developers due to a sudden increase in project demands in this field of expertise.
We are currently offering a very competitive relocation assistance package that includes visa sponsorship, flights and accommodation for the first month of your employment, while you get set up in the thriving Irish tech scene. We will ensure your relocation is hassle free and fully coordinated through our experienced HR & Workplace Experience Teams, meaning you can be free to focus on the exciting new projects you'll be getting involved in, with some of our major clients in the Fintech, Telecoms and Automotive industries.
If this sounds like an exciting opportunity that you'd like to hear more about, please apply now to discuss it further with our Ireland Recruitment Team.

About You:  
Ideally you'll tick as many of the following boxes as possible:  Show more

Who We Are

Overhaul is a supply chain integrity solutions company that allows shippers to connect disparate sources of data into the first fully transparent situational analysis engine designed for the logistics industry. Data that is transformed into critical insights can instantly trigger corrective actions, impacting everything from temperature control to handling requirements or package-level tracking, ensuring cargo arrives at its destination safely, undamaged, and on time. We are a dynamic, innovative, and fun team who is highly committed to our customers' experiences and our Mission and Vision.

The Role

We are looking for a driven individual who is excited about the possibility of finding unique solutions to practical problems. Someone who is open to learning about new technologies, able to take ownership of tasks that contribute to the team, and gets excited about playing a part in all levels of the process. The ideal candidate for this position will have experience with technologies at all levels of the web stack (e.g. HTML/CSS/JS, Java, JSP, OSGI) in particular Javascript frameworks like Angular and/or React experience. If this sounds like you and you enjoy working in a fast paced, agile environment, we would love to hear from you.

Responsibilities

Capture and translate business requirements into appropriate design and technical documentation
Contribute technical expertise throughout all stages of product design and development
Ensure the technical feasibility of product discussions and UI/UX mocks
Work closely with UX designers, project managers, and back-end engineers
Using the required programming languages and other technologies, writes code, completes programming, and performs testing and debugging of applications
Adopt agile development methodologies and participate with team members in the planning and review of projects
Design, implement and test enhancement feature requests to enhance product functionality as needed.
Offer alternatives when technology constraints require design compromises
Ensures products are up to date with 3rd party components that are in use.
May interact with internal cross-functional members to better understand system requirements and/or necessary modifications.

About you
2+ years' experience developing web, software, or mobile applications/ 2+ years of professional website coding experience
Strong Ruby on Rails/JavaScript skills are a must
Exposure to agile development processes
Solid communication skills: Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences
Have a passion for quality, innovation, and world-class design
Experience writing maintainable, well tested, reliable code
Experience in a fast-paced, collaborative environment

What we commit to you:

Fully covered health insurance
24 days annual leave + 3 company days
Competitive starting base salary
Progressive advancement opportunity and career mobility
Employee Assistance Program
Flexible working

Overhaul has always been, and always will be, committed to diversity and inclusion. Our Overhaul Culture Code's top listed commitment is to "Diversity and Synergy." All aspects of employment will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. Good written and oral communication
Ability to think creatively and solve complex problems
Team player with strong interpersonal skills and a willingness to help others

Work at the forefront of automotive innovation with ZF,
one of the world’s leading automotive suppliers.
Senior Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Location:
Dublin, IE, D02 AE12
Req ID 41642 Dublin, Ireland
ZF is a global technology company supplying systems for passenger cars, commercial vehicles and industrial technology, enabling the next generation of mobility. ZF allows vehicles to see, think and act. In the four technology domains of Vehicle Motion Control, Integrated Safety, Automated Driving, and Electric Mobility, ZF offers comprehensive product and software solutions for established vehicle manufacturers and newly emerging transport and mobility service providers. With its products and its more than 150,000 employees around the world, ZF contributes to reducing emissions, protecting the climate and enhancing safe mobility.

We are currently looking for skilled people that want to have an impact with their work to join a newly formed ZF Aftermarket Product Engineering team in our existing Dublin office. Over the next 12 months, this team will be working to bring a new customer-facing platform from concept to production through a deeply collaborative effort between our engineering, UX, Product and Data members. The team will leverage the company's existing knowledge of both the industry and technologies to create a digital product that will help reduce CO2 emissions of fleets, improve road safety and provide predictability and value to its customers. This is a unique opportunity to have an early and significant impact on shaping both the new engineering organization and product while having the security of being part of one of the world's largest automotive suppliers.

About the Senior Data Engineer:
As a Senior Data Engineer, you are part of a small highly skilled, innovative, and motivated development team in the construction and exploitation of new digital solutions for fleets developed using cutting-edge technologies in web and mobile applications, together with cloud computing. You will be working closely with the product team, and senior server-side and front-end developers, to build responsive, data-centric rich web and mobile applications.

Your tasks:
Conduct complex data analysis and report on results
Interpret trends and patterns
Build algorithms and prototypes
Build and maintain data systems and pipelines
Improving data quality and efficiency
Designing infrastructure for greater scalability

Your profile:
Computer Science degree or equivalent
8+ Years of software development working in an agile environment.
Minimum 5 years of experience in a Data Engineer or similar role
Knowledge of programming languages (e.g. Python and NodeJS)
Technical expertise with data models, data mining, and segmentation techniques
Strong analytical skills
Ability to combine data from different sources
Hands-on experience with data platforms like Databricks is a plus
Experience in near real time analytics and Machine Learning is a plus

Why ZF in Dublin?
You will work in an open and transparent corporate culture where ownership, accountability, diversity and respect are important values. Our employees are passionate about their job and are all convinced that team spirit and fun are at the heart of our success. Our teamwork in an environment with healthy self-reflection and improvement ingrained in our approach, where outside ideas are genuinely valued, and every member can influence decisions or question current norms.

In this stimulating, fast-growing and challenging environment, we offer you:
Competitive compensation package that includes base salary, bonus scheme and benefits
24 days annual leave, 11 bank holidays (incl. Good Friday)
Pension scheme with up to 5% matching contribution
Comprehensive company health care scheme with Laya – including up to max. 500 EUR yearly refund for Routine Dental
Meaningful development and career opportunities
Flexible and hybrid work models

The position is part of the ZF Global Employee Referral Program.

Be part of our ZF team as Senior Data Engineer (m/f/d) and apply now!

Company Description
We pledge "to prove IT can make a real difference to our customer's businesses". We work hard to ensure we understand what our customers need from their technology solutions and then we deliver.

We are an award-winning company who provide world class customer service; we think big and we hire great people. Version 1 are more than just another IT services company - we are leaders in implementing and supporting Oracle, Microsoft and AWS technologies.

Invest in us and we’ll invest in you; if you are driven, committed and up for a challenge, we want to meet you.

Job Description
We are looking for a Java Developer to join a team of engineers that create solutions and deliver both mobile and web applications to our clients. The ideal candidate is someone who has a track record of high-quality delivery, combined with a keen appetite for all aspects of software development. These roles are working with greenfield projects where you will have the opportunities to recommend and champion the use of new technologies whether for direct use in products or in supporting the development lifecycle. You should be hands on, able to contribute individually and should have experience with-in a fast pace dynamic environment.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Implement solutions as per technical design and participate in design activities as required
Planning and estimation of development tasks as part of the SCRUM team and strive for accuracy while meeting deadlines
Participate in the full development lifecycle of new functionality and enhancements on greenfield and existing applications
Commitment to producing high quality, highly performant and robust software within agreed time estimates and to agreed quality standards
Participate in changes, and continuous improvements to existing software development, testing and deployment processes
Ability to work hands on in a fast-paced, agile work environment supporting your colleagues as required
Ability to work in a team and collaborate with multiple business and technical teams

Qualifications

5 years’ experience in software development (Java, .Net, Python etc), ideally at least 2+ years of which was working with Java as the principal technology used.
Strong knowledge of Java, JavaEE, Spring framework, JUnit, Kafka, TDD, and SQL
Strong OOD and knowledge of design patterns including event driven architectures and integration patterns
Good working knowledge of CI/CD, GitOps, methodologies and tools
Experience working with containerized environments Kubernetes/OpenShift, and AWS: i.e. Lambda and RDS
Experience working in a cross functional Scrum team in an agile environment
Knowledge of ETL and CDC are desirable
Be flexible and hardworking both independently and as part of a team
A willingness and enthusiasm to improve and develop new skills and learn new technologies
Excellent problem solving and communication skills both written and verbal
Effective communication with all team members and a positive and constructive attitude
Constant improvement of products, through feedback and input on the product pipeline and roadmap
Related degree qualification (comp sci, engineering, etc)
Additional Information
Before you apply, here are some of our benefits. We offer profit share, pension, private medical, flexible working policy and more. We offer incentives for accreditations and educational assistance for courses relevant to your role.
We offer employee recognition in the form of Excellence Awards and V1Ps which is awarded by your peers. Engagement is incredibly important with local engagement teams driving our engagement events!
Anthony Cronin,
Version 1 Talent Acquisition Team
Tel: +353 1 901 9038
anthony.cronin@version1.com Company Description
We pledge "to prove IT can make a real difference to our customer's businesses". We work hard to ensure we understand what our customers need from their technology solutions and then we deliver.

We are an award-winning company who provide world class customer service; we think big and we hire great people. Version 1 are more than just another IT services company - we are leaders in implementing and supporting Oracle, Microsoft and AWS technologies.

Invest in us and we’ll invest in you; if you are driven, committed and up for a challenge, we want to meet you.

Job Description
We are looking for a Java Developer to join a team of engineers that create solutions and deliver both mobile and web applications to our clients. The ideal candidate is someone who has a track record of high-quality delivery, combined with a keen appetite for all aspects of software development. These roles are working with greenfield projects where you will have the opportunities to recommend and champion the use of new technologies whether for direct use in products or in supporting the development lifecycle. You should be hands on, able to contribute individually and should have experience with-in a fast pace dynamic environment.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Implement solutions as per technical design and participate in design activities as required
Planning and estimation of development tasks as part of the SCRUM team and strive for accuracy while meeting deadlines
Participate in the full development lifecycle of new functionality and enhancements on greenfield and existing applications
Commitment to producing high quality, highly performant and robust software within agreed time estimates and to agreed quality standards
Participate in changes, and continuous improvements to existing software development, testing and deployment processes
Ability to work hands on in a fast-paced, agile work environment supporting your colleagues as required
Ability to work in a team and collaborate with multiple business and technical teams

Qualifications

5 years’ experience in software development (Java, .Net, Python etc), ideally at least 2+ years of which was working with Java as the principal technology used.
Strong knowledge of Java, JavaEE, Spring framework, JUnit, Kafka, TDD, and SQL
Strong OOD and knowledge of design patterns including event driven architectures and integration patterns
Good working knowledge of CI/CD, GitOps, methodologies and tools
Experience working with containerized environments Kubernetes/OpenShift, and AWS: i.e. Lambda and RDS
Experience working in a cross functional Scrum team in an agile environment
Knowledge of ETL and CDC are desirable
Be flexible and hardworking both independently and as part of a team
A willingness and enthusiasm to improve and develop new skills and learn new technologies
Excellent problem solving and communication skills both written and verbal
Effective communication with all team members and a positive and constructive attitude
Constant improvement of products, through feedback and input on the product pipeline and roadmap
Related degree qualification (comp sci, engineering, etc)
Additional Information
Before you apply, here are some of our benefits. We offer profit share, pension, private medical, flexible working policy and more. We offer incentives for accreditations and educational assistance for courses relevant to your role.
We offer employee recognition in the form of Excellence Awards and V1Ps which is awarded by your peers. Engagement is incredibly important with local engagement teams driving our engagement events!

At Deloitte, we deliver the solutions and insights our clients need to address their most complex business challenges. As the world’s largest global professional services and consulting network, Deloitte Ireland has nearly 3,000 people providing audit & assurance, tax, consulting, and corporate finance services to public and private clients spanning multiple industries.
Deloitte’s Consulting Practice is one of the world's leading Management Consulting firms for executable Strategy, Operations, Technology, and Human Capital Advisory services. The consulting practice is built around integrated core capabilities - people, process, technology and industry expertise - the capabilities needed to help clients to tackle their most complex challenges.
At Deloitte, we trust our people to make the right choices around how, where and when they work. Our empowered hybrid way of working allows you to be collaborative, learn from colleagues, share your experiences, build the relationships that will fuel your career and work on individual projects in a way that works for you and our clients. Deloitte Works is built on trust and allows our people to have flexibility and control in how they work. If you apply for a role, please speak to your recruiter or hiring manager to discuss hybrid working and how it could work for you. Read more about Deloitte Works here.
Deloitte will ensure any reasonable accommodations are implemented as part of the recruitment and selection process.
Deloitte is an equal opportunities employer.
.
About Deloitte Digital
At Deloitte Digital we work with our clients to develop customer-centric organizations – helping them take on the challenges of tomorrow and beyond.
We work with clients from different industries – from financial services to agriculture and pharmaceuticals – in the largest enterprises across the country. We help them innovate, adapt to the new world and embrace changes.
In everything we do, we’re guided by our aspiration to elevate the human experience.
About the role
We’re growing and are looking to expand our engineering team. We’re looking for an experienced AEM developer with strong background in both backend and frontend technologies.
What you will do:
Develop business-critical and complex web or mobile solutions that perform flawlessly across all platforms.
Solve unique and challenging technical problems to support our clients.
Work in a highly collaborative environment with cross-functional teams on projects ranging from a few weeks to a couple of years in length.
Clearly and concisely communicate highly technical challenges and solutions to clients and non-technical team members.
Maintain a high standard of quality as you creatively and strategically problem solve throughout the product delivery process.
Continuously learn and keep up to date with the latest technologies and be able to pick the right one to solve client’s problem.
What you will need:
Experience in working efficiently with team members and clients across different location and time zones.
Strong experience in developing, enhancing, and operating AEM 6.x and AEM as a Cloud Service.
Solid experience in JCR APIs, Sling Framework, Apache Felix, and Granite.
Experience in headless implementation using AEM.
Expertise in AEM building blocks like Templates, Core Components, Hybrid capabilities, Sling Resource Merger, Sling Dynamic Include.
Expertise in AEM based unit testing using Mockito, Junit 5, JCR, Sling Mocks, and OSGI Mocks.
Expertise in workflows and workflow APIs.
Experience in Slor search and integration with AEM both as Oak and REST.
Experience in Adobe performance tuning and optimization.
Good understanding of replication strategies, dispatcher configuration, system admin features, user permissions, ACLs.
Experience with frontend libraries and frameworks such as React, Angular.
Familiarity with Adobe Launch, Adobe Analytics, A/B testing using Adobe Target.
Expertise in software architecture, fluency with software design patterns, understanding of TDD, experience with DDD.
Understanding of secure software development, experience with working on solutions with high security standards. Awareness of security pitfalls in web and mobile app development.
Understanding of development methodologies, such as Scrum and Kanban.
Understanding of DevOps and experience with DevOps tooling.
Strong desire to learn new technologies, skills, and domains of knowledge to be efficient across different clients and industries.
You do not need to know all of the things listed above! We encourage you to apply even if you don’t match 100% of the requirements.
Hiring Process
We strive to keep our hiring process simple and efficient. It is impossible to get a full view of someone’s professional skills by just having multiple long interviews with them. Instead, our hiring process is designed to understand how person is approaching problems and how they think about them.
The three simple steps are:
1. Screening interview with one of our engineering managers.
2. 1 to 1½ hours interview on technical and leadership topics.
3. Offer. At Deloitte, we deliver the solutions and insights our clients need to address their most complex business challenges. As the world’s largest global professional services and consulting network, Deloitte Ireland has nearly 3,000 people providing audit & assurance, tax, consulting, and corporate finance services to public and private clients spanning multiple industries.
Deloitte’s Consulting Practice is one of the world's leading Management Consulting firms for executable Strategy, Operations, Technology, and Human Capital Advisory services. The consulting practice is built around integrated core capabilities - people, process, technology and industry expertise - the capabilities needed to help clients to tackle their most complex challenges.
At Deloitte, we trust our people to make the right choices around how, where and when they work. Our empowered hybrid way of working allows you to be collaborative, learn from colleagues, share your experiences, build the relationships that will fuel your career and work on individual projects in a way that works for you and our clients. Deloitte Works is built on trust and allows our people to have flexibility and control in how they work. If you apply for a role, please speak to your recruiter or hiring manager to discuss hybrid working and how it could work for you. Read more about Deloitte Works here.
Deloitte will ensure any reasonable accommodations are implemented as part of the recruitment and selection process.
Deloitte is an equal opportunities employer.

job_title: Technology Consulting (DET) - Business Intelligence Developer - Manager
listing_jobDesc:
As part of our Consulting team, applications are currently being invited for the role of Business Intelligence Developer in Dublin. The successful candidate will have overall responsibility for delivering a high-performing and functional mobile channel.
Skills and attributes
Proven experience in using SAP Business Objects, including version 4.3 specifically in relation to:
Development of reporting universes and individual reports
Troubleshooting issues with existing Business Objects reports
Design and development of dashboard solutions
Business Objects System Administration
Proven development and SAP Business Objects expertise to propose quality solutions for approval by the Department’s appropriate design authorities
Proven expertise in the management and support of the Microsoft Database Developer environment SQL server 2017, particularly the following:
SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Data Extraction, Transform, Load (ETL)
Transactional SQL (T-SQL)
SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS)
DBA design and tuning
Data Warehousing, including design and modelling
Dimensional Modelling
Proven experience in the design, build, and maintenance of a large-scale Data Warehouse and demonstrable ability in recommending best practices
Documentation skills, specifically with regard to reviewing and documenting current Business Intelligence infrastructure and toolsets as well as training material/documentation and in-team training sessions
Proven experience in the design and optimization of ETL scripts
Demonstrable ability in the design, development, and implementation of dashboards and other visualization solutions to present data in an easy-to-use meaningful fashion
Proven experience in supporting project delivery teams in fulfilling reporting solutions, including knowledge of GDPR and privacy by design in reporting solutions
Soft Skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
Good creative problem-solving skills
Self-motivated, flexible, and adaptable
Proven capacity to respond to changes to the program, proactively resolve and deliver to the best possible outcome
Demonstrable ability to propose quality solutions and best practice
Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills; sound organizational, negotiating, and decision-making skills
Demonstrable expertise in upskilling colleagues by means of knowledge sharing and skills transfer in specific areas, such as (but not limited to) Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Database Administration and SAP Business Objects
Proven experience in skills transfer/knowledge sharing
To qualify for the role, you must have
Relevant Degree/qualification
Minimum 5 years’ ICT experience with at least 3 years in a .NET enterprise environment
Ideally, you’ll also
Fulfil the role of Team Lead, if required
What working at EY offers
At EY, we’re dedicated to helping our clients, from start-ups to Fortune 500 companies — and the work we do with them is as varied as they are.
You get to work with inspiring and meaningful projects. Our focus is education and coaching alongside practical experience to ensure your personal development. We value our employees, and you will be able to control your own development with an individual progression plan. You will quickly grow into a responsible role with challenging and stimulating assignments. Moreover, you will be part of an interdisciplinary environment that emphasizes high quality and knowledge exchange. Plus, we offer:
Support, coaching, and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
About EY
As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction, and consulting services, we’re using the finance products, expertise, and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities, and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2021 a reality.
Join us in building a better working world.

And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2021 a reality.
Join us in building a better working world.
Apply now As part of our Consulting team, applications are currently being invited for the role of Business Intelligence Developer in Dublin. The successful candidate will have overall responsibility for delivering a high-performing and functional mobile channel.
Skills and attributes
Proven experience in using SAP Business Objects, including version 4.3 specifically in relation to:
Development of reporting universes and individual reports
Troubleshooting issues with existing Business Objects reports
Design and development of dashboard solutions
Business Objects System Administration
Proven development and SAP Business Objects expertise to propose quality solutions for approval by the Department’s appropriate design authorities
Proven expertise in the management and support of the Microsoft Database Developer environment SQL server 2017, particularly the following:
SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Data Extraction, Transform, Load (ETL)
Transactional SQL (T-SQL)
SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS)
DBA design and tuning
Data Warehousing, including design and modelling
Dimensional Modelling
Proven experience in the design, build, and maintenance of a large-scale Data Warehouse and demonstrable ability in recommending best practices
Documentation skills, specifically with regard to reviewing and documenting current Business Intelligence infrastructure and toolsets as well as training material/documentation and in-team training sessions
Proven experience in the design and optimization of ETL scripts
Demonstrable ability in the design, development, and implementation of dashboards and other visualization solutions to present data in an easy-to-use meaningful fashion
Proven experience in supporting project delivery teams in fulfilling reporting solutions, including knowledge of GDPR and privacy by design in reporting solutions
Soft Skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
Good creative problem-solving skills
Self-motivated, flexible, and adaptable
Proven capacity to respond to changes to the program, proactively resolve and deliver to the best possible outcome
Demonstrable ability to propose quality solutions and best practice
Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills; sound organizational, negotiating, and decision-making skills
Demonstrable expertise in upskilling colleagues by means of knowledge sharing and skills transfer in specific areas, such as (but not limited to) Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Database Administration and SAP Business Objects
Proven experience in skills transfer/knowledge sharing
To qualify for the role, you must have
Relevant Degree/qualification
Minimum 5 years’ ICT experience with at least 3 years in a .NET enterprise environment
Ideally, you’ll also
Fulfil the role of Team Lead, if required
What working at EY offers
At EY, we’re dedicated to helping our clients, from start-ups to Fortune 500 companies — and the work we do with them is as varied as they are.
You get to work with inspiring and meaningful projects. Our focus is education and coaching alongside practical experience to ensure your personal development. We value our employees, and you will be able to control your own development with an individual progression plan. You will quickly grow into a responsible role with challenging and stimulating assignments. Moreover, you will be part of an interdisciplinary environment that emphasizes high quality and knowledge exchange. Plus, we offer:
Support, coaching, and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
About EY
As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction, and consulting services, we’re using the finance products, expertise, and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities, and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2021 a reality.
Join us in building a better working world.
Apply now 
Fulfil the role of Team Lead, if required Show more

Software Engineer: Front-EndDing is the world’s leading universal top-up service. Founded in 2006, Ding was born from seeing something that wasn’t there. More than 80% of the world’s 5 billion mobile phones are now prepaid – and growing. We believe mobile phones can change lives and we want to improve people’s lives by helping those with less gain access to more.Our aim is to build and run the safest, simplest, most effective and convenient top-up technology, in partnership with the best operators and platforms. We’ll continue to spread joy across the globe helping people everywhere to send little bytes of happiness to their loved ones, keeping our customers connected to their families and friends. Now more than ever we realise the importance of keeping in touch and here at Ding we believe a little goes a long way.Job overview: We’re looking for a talented technology enthusiast to join our Engineering team as a Software Engineer reporting to our Senior Engineering Manager.We are looking for puzzle solver with leadership qualities, you will be able to learn our tools quickly and hey, maybe you can suggest some new ones to us too! The role will see you immersed in a team of web developers, with embedded Product and QA. You’ll perform hands on development with our exciting technology stack and play a key part in the design and decision-making process.Responsibilities & Duties: While the role is hands-on from a coding perspective, there’s also a strong emphasis on being involved with enhancing design, technical standards, improving the development process and the ongoing investigation around new technologies. Here at Ding you’ll have the opportunity to develop your skills at a rapid pace and be given exposure to industry-leading hardware and software solutions.Delivering new features on our high-volume web infrastructure that contribute to Ding’s constant growth.Working with the latest platforms and tooling including React, Redux, ES6, Typescript, Gatsby, Cypress, Storybook, styled components etc.Being part of a highly effective Agile team with multiple disciplines (currently working with Kanban) and a focus on continual improvement.Qualifications & Experience: 3+ years commercial experience in a web development role developing high scale applicationsStrong front end web experience (HTML/CSS/JavaScript) skills essentialKnowledge of working with front end JS frameworks such as React. (a good understanding of React.js and its core principles is important for this role)Experience in best practices in application development; including Scrum\Kanban, Continuous Integration, Test-Driven DevelopmentKnowledge of modern technology concepts; best practices and patterns including API first development and HTTP technologiesExperience in any of the following; Gatsby, Cypress, Redux, Jest, Storybook or styled components is a plusTeam player who can collaborate with other teams when required including design, product and marketing among othersStrong communication skills both verbal and written and a willingness to support/mentor other team members including participating in regular code reviewsSome experience with C# would be desirable but not essentialThe ideal candidate will be passionate about the latest trends in enterprise level technology and wants to be a part of a high performance development team working on the delivery of a complex, web-scale platform and application suite.About Ding: Ding is headquartered in Dublin, Ireland, and has offices in Barcelona, Bucharest, Dhaka, Dubai, New Jersey and Paris.Ding’s culturally diverse team is made up of 28 different nationalities, working in 20 teams with over 200 unique personalities which reflects our commitment to delivering cutting-edge, potentially life-changing technology to developed and emerging markets alike.We're always on the lookout for talented people who embody our core values:We are Customer CuriousWe are Thinkers, Linkers & DoersWe Work Better TogetherWe Seek Out that SparkDing’s recruitment privacy notice is available at https://www.ding.com/recruitment-privacy-noticeJob Type: Full-time Software Engineer: Front-EndDing is the world’s leading universal top-up service. job_title: Senior Software Developer - Digital Twin Solutions (ATM and Retail)
listing_jobDesc:
The opportunity

The ATM and Retail business unit of Digital Twin Solutions focuses on solutions to extend Unity's success within the Automotive, Transportation, Retail, and broader manufacturing industries. We leverage Unity technologies to create scalable solutions for all sizes of companies. With every engagement we learn more about the requirements of these industries and endeavour to take our learnings forward into continually improving solutions. Members of our team will be able to help shape these solutions and hone the skills most applicable to these industries.

Are you interested in applying your technical skillset across different industries for global companies? You'll solve difficult problems and implement core features, playing a meaningful role in building and delivering high-quality projects. You're an experienced software developer that owns your work and maintains a passion for learning and growing. Our cross-disciplinary teams consist of world-class developers, technical artists, 3D artists, UX & UI designers, and staff dedicated to software quality. Our goal is to inspire customers and transform industries!

We're committed to maintaining a diverse team and welcome and encourage applicants with diverse experiences and backgrounds.

What you'll be doing

Working with a software development team lead and a project team of designers, project managers and quality analysts to develop best-in-class applications
Working with the creative team to realize a design concept into implementation
Helping drive the technical direction of software features with your lead.
Participating in code reviews to ensure only high-quality software is committed
Following agile software development methodologies

What we're looking for

Proven track record of delivering products with Unity and C#
Strong understanding of all aspects of the software development lifecycle
Good communicator with the ability to work as part of a team of diverse skillsets
Experience with AR/VR, mobile apps, desktop applications or games
Ability to find creative solutions to difficult problems

You might also have

Experience with 3D graphics rendering and optimization techniques
Experience with cloud development, IoT, simulation, or machine learning
Experience integrating new software development with existing enterprise systems

Life at Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) is the world's leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world's most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity's platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment and celebrate our employees across age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. Our differences are strengths that enable us to support the growing and evolving needs of our customers, partners, and collaborators. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

#SEN #LI-JL1 Show more

You will be responsible for:

As a Technical Team Leader of a DevOps team in Marco Polo Network Engineering, you take accountability for the output of the whole team and are responsible for each of the team members individual growth and well-being. You are the voice of the team in the broader engineering and company contexts but also encourage the individual voices to be heard. You will work with your team and the wider engineering groups to agree direction and architectural approaches. Once the team have committed to their deliverables you will ensure that the team's goals are met.
In Marco Polo we manage via Objectives and Key Results, and you will be responsible for ensuring that the team and individual OKRs reflect, support, and deliver on the company OKRs.
On any given day you might:

We’re looking for people with a strong background in and interest in building network management + CICD systems and while also building developer tools, dashboards and data pipelines.

Management and development of continuous integration and deployment solutions for production applications across various services.
Spearhead the creation of new technology infrastructure and maintains configuration, automation and infrastructure as code tools.
Run the team responsible for troubleshooting issues in development systems
Responsible for the architecture and technical leadership of the entire DevOps infrastructure.
Designing, building, and optimizing comprehensive automation systems that operate the business’s network, web, mobile and data infrastructure platforms.
Collaborate with engineering leadership and assist engineering teams in the navigation of technologies such as Go, Python, Groovy, Postgres, Kubernetes and so forth.
Coach the engineering development department personnel in the workings of reusable tools and patterns.
Keep up with industry best practices and trends on behalf of the DevOps department and the larger engineering department.
Conduct research, tests, and implement new metrics collection systems that can be reused and applied to any site/software development project.
Lead the design, build, and running of systems behind the Marco Polo Network
Plan for the growth of Marco Polo Network’s infrastructure
Continuously improve everything we do, debug production issues
Implement more effective ways of supporting our clients and team
Find innovative ways to overcome complex technical challenges
Reporting the right things in the right way at the right time
Acting as a gatekeeper you will work in a way that protects our people, systems and complies with our InfoSec and security policies and procedures
Continuously improve how we get things done; recommend and implement better faster more effective ways of supporting our clients and team
Effectively execute any special projects or ad-hoc tasks as assigned


You will bring

At least 5 years of working experience in a DevOps capacity, preferably as a DevOps Engineer.
Experience automating the management of large-scale infrastructure and have significant familiarity with Kubernetes, Helm, infrastructure as code and configuration management technologies.
Vast experience in systems automation, orchestration, deployment, and implementation.
Experience using Jenkins and Linux as well as experience configuring and automating monitoring tools.
Experience in software development and experience working with tools and languages such as Go, SaaS, Git, Python, Shell scripting, Java, and PostgresDB.
Experience in scaling distributed data systems, for example, Elasticsearch, Prometheus, VictoriaMetrics, among others. The candidate will further have had experience with highly scalable systems.
A keen understanding of monitoring solutions for all layers of web infrastructure.
A comprehensive understanding of at least two cloud technologies, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platforms, AWS or IBM Cloud.
Must be a result oriented individual and helpful in nature.
Must be a creative and strategic thinker.
Be highly analytical, work comfortably in a constantly evolving environment.
Work comfortably in a collaborative environment.
Have an ability to multi-task and meet tight deadlines.
Have an ability to remain calm in the face of uncertainty and stress.
Highly proactive and effective written and verbal communication skills
Ability and willingness to take initiative and get things done
A strong desire to exceed client expectation’s (internal & external) is a must
An entrepreneurial and adaptable approach is a pre-requisite


 What you can expect:

Life in a fast-moving start-up environment and all that entails.
Competitive salary
25 days annual leave (plus bank holidays), pension scheme
Flexi-lifestyle benefits (tailor your options to what is important to you; i.e. Health care, fitness, travel, continuous professional development etc)
MacBook or Dell XPS? You choose the type of equipment you need to work more efficiently
Keep active with numerous fitness team events and challenges organised throughout the year
Growing your family? We know how important those first few months are for both parents and we are offering paid leave for both mums and dads so you can enjoy the new arrival!
All the tools and supports needed to do an excellent job
Ability to make a difference
A dynamic workplace with a great balance of hard work and fun
A culture of innovation and a structure in which to innovate
A nurturing team-oriented environment with mentorship as a key feature of the dynamic You will be responsible for:

Experience in scaling distributed data systems, for example, Elasticsearch, Prometheus, VictoriaMetrics, among others. The candidate will further have had experience with highly scalable systems.
A keen understanding of monitoring solutions for all layers of web infrastructure.
A comprehensive understanding of at least two cloud technologies, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platforms, AWS or IBM Cloud.
Must be a result oriented individual and helpful in nature.
Must be a creative and strategic thinker.
Be highly analytical, work comfortably in a constantly evolving environment.
Work comfortably in a collaborative environment.
Have an ability to multi-task and meet tight deadlines.
Have an ability to remain calm in the face of uncertainty and stress.
Highly proactive and effective written and verbal communication skills
Ability and willingness to take initiative and get things done
A strong desire to exceed client expectation’s (internal & external) is a must
An entrepreneurial and adaptable approach is a pre-requisite


 What you can expect:

Life in a fast-moving start-up environment and all that entails.
Competitive salary
25 days annual leave (plus bank holidays), pension scheme
Flexi-lifestyle benefits (tailor your options to what is important to you; i.e. Health care, fitness, travel, continuous professional development etc)
MacBook or Dell XPS? You choose the type of equipment you need to work more efficiently
Keep active with numerous fitness team events and challenges organised throughout the year
Growing your family? We know how important those first few months are for both parents and we are offering paid leave for both mums and dads so you can enjoy the new arrival!
All the tools and supports needed to do an excellent job
Ability to make a difference
A dynamic workplace with a great balance of hard work and fun
A culture of innovation and a structure in which to innovate
A nurturing team-oriented environment with mentorship as a key feature of the dynamic Show more

Java/Scala Engineer - Dublin based - Hybrid approach to WFH and office based working


What can I expect from the Role?

We are building a development function to continuously improve, extend or replace the existing stack of applications and systems under the ownership of the Trading Tribe at PPB. Projects undertaken by this group will be many and varied and will mean that in joining this team you will gain exposure to a wide variety of applications, development approaches and technologies. We have an opportunity to look at our existing estate and to find ways to add value through optimising, automating, re-architecting and through the addition of new features and creation of new platforms where necessary.

We use Scala and Java where appropriate to build our platforms, and are focused on using the right technology for each task.


Is this you?
You have experience using agile and lean practices to deliver world class software. You are a Kaizen creature who never stops thinking about how to improve yourself and your team.

When hardware fails, your applications keep going because they are fault tolerant. When the company grows, your applications scale right alongside. Customers enjoy using your applications, because they are reactive and always perform well.

You understand that building the ‘right thing' is as important as building the ‘thing right', and have leveraged test-driven techniques such as ATDD to achieve both. You believe that software quality is the responsibility of the whole team, regardless of job titles.

You understand and embrace the philosophy of Continuous Delivery. You have no interest in throwing your work ‘over the wall' to anybody. Instead, you passionately believe in an agile, DevOps-centric team that builds, tests, releases and operates its own applications.


What are the experiences & Qualifications Required?

Experience as a Java or Scala programmer
An understanding of Event-driven, messaging-based systems
Messaging brokering technologies (experience in RabbitMQ and/or Kafka an advantage)
Dependency Injection (experience in Spring an advantage)
Storage technologies (SQL and/or NoSQL)
Test-driven development techniques (e.g. BDD and ATDD)
Automated testing and mocking techniques
Clean coding
Agile and Lean approaches


Who are we?

Paddy Power Betfair is an international sports betting and gaming operator, with a market-leading presence in the UK and Ireland, as well as a range of operations across Europe including Romania, Portugal and Malta.

We are online-led, mobile-led and sports-led: and our proprietary technology, unique products and innovative marketing all combine to offer a superb experience to our five million customers worldwide.

Our spirit, talent and ambition has taken us into the FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange and we now employ over 7,000 people in sixteen locations across the globe; from Dublin to Los Angeles, and London to Melbourne. Our culture rewards innovation, teamwork and we like to stay fast-moving in a dynamic industry.


ON A LARGER SCALE

We are part of Flutter Entertainment, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider for over thirteen million customers worldwide.

Established in 2019, Flutter merged with The Stars Group in 2020. As the parent company Flutter Entertainment now has a host of brands that sit under it including Paddy Power and Betfair (PPB), Sky Betting and Gaming, PokerStars, Timeform, OddsChecker, Sporting Life, SportsBet (in Australia), FOX Bet, TVG and FanDuel in the US.

Across the globe, Flutter employs over 14,000 people across more than 40 offices and over 600 retail sites. We pride ourselves on being a responsible operator, committed to making a positive contribution to the communities we operate within.


WHAT IS OUR CHALLENGE?

We deliver products at scale for over 5 million customers, 99,9% of transactions in less than a second
The products you'll develop will comply with ambitious uptime targets: less than 50 minutes downtime expected per year
Our systems process more than 7 million transactions every day (more than all the European stock exchanges combined)
We deliver high transitional products, serving more than 2.5Bn calls a day
We have a diverse and up to date technical landscape to explore, leverage and innovate on


What sort of benefits can I expect?

The Fun Stuff
Bonus scheme
Flexible working hours and working from home options
Uncapped Holiday Allowance (yes, you heard right)
Health and well being with free classes (yoga, bootcamp, swimming etc.)
Ministry of Fun who organise cool events throughout the year, like Bingo Loco
Career Progression
Global Mobility across all locations

The Boring Stuff
Pension Scheme
Subsidised Canteen
Life Insurance
Health Insurance
Access to thousands of online courses

As the tech firm that created the mobile world, and with more than 54,000 patents to our name, we’ve made it our business to make a mark. When joining our team at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead, and perform at your best, shaping the future of technology. This is a place where you're welcomed as your own perfectly unique self and celebrated for the skills, talent, and perspective you bring to the team. Are you in? Come, and be where it begins.
Our Exciting Opportunity
Ericsson is a key driver in the acceleration and creation of a truly Cloud Native RAN. We own our solution from architecture definition to deployment in the customer network. In this role, you will be part of an engineering team with full ownership of a key aspect of our product.
You will work and collaborate with leading experts in Radio and Cloud Native technologies including 5G, Public & Private Clouds, Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence!
To set ourselves up for greatness we count on our technical staff to truly embody our business area’s three C’s, Customer Focus, Collaboration, and Can-do, to drive the realization of the Ericsson RAN Network Management portfolio.
You will
Design, develop, test, deploy and maintain Cloud Native components and microservices
Be responsible for the deployment automation and configuration of Databases in Ericsson Network Management
Adopt microservice cloud-native paradigms and continuous integration / continuous deployment models to realize the full potential of cloud-native solutions
Work with the team driving improvements and efficiencies within our products and processes
Work with architects on the evolution of technical solutions
Focus on best-in-class product quality and customer experience
To be successful in the role you must have
Proficiency in Python and Git
Decent Knowledge of Bash
Excellent troubleshooting skills
Knowledge of Linux deployments (Red-Hat, or Suse or Centos is a plus)
Growth mindset
Have 5+ years of relevant Software Development experience
Have a BSc/MSc level in Computer Science or the equivalent level of knowledge
Be proficient in English, written and spoken
Preferred(bonus) / Not Required
Kubernetes/Helm/Docker
Knowledge of Go
Knowledge of Postgres or Neo4j– deployment & configurations
Experience with High Availability (eg Patroni for Postgres or causal cluster for Neo4j)
Maven, Jenkins, Puppet, Ansible
What´s in it for you?
A healthy work-life balance (flexible hours, maternity/paternity and parental leave)
We support all forms of workplace environments, from using the office as a full or part time workspace with remote working within Ireland
27 days annual leave, a family-friendly work environment
We’re a diverse bunch, over 60 nationalities on-site. Expand your horizons in a rich multicultural environment with colleagues from all over the world
Clearly defined career paths, enhanced with inhouse training and financial support for external study
Dynamic 600+ member sports and social club run activities & subsidized theatre, movie, swimming tickets
Opportunities to travel around the world and work directly with our customers before they go live
Pension scheme, health insurance, company doctor, life cover and sick pay/income continuance plan
Laptop and mobile phone, tax saver commuter/bike to work scheme
Athlone is located beside a beautiful Lough Ree and is a one-hour drive from Galway or Dublin
You can also learn more about why our software campus in Athlone is a great place to work: Video Link
We also support relocation overseas for successful applicants.
Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team.
Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.
Primary country and city: Ireland (IE) || Ireland : Leinster : Athlone || Ireland : Leinster : Dublin || Ireland : Westmeath : Athlone

Knowledge of Linux deployments (Red-Hat, or Suse or Centos is a plus)
Growth mindset
Have 5+ years of relevant Software Development experience
Have a BSc/MSc level in Computer Science or the equivalent level of knowledge
Be proficient in English, written and spoken
Preferred(bonus) / Not Required
Kubernetes/Helm/Docker
Knowledge of Go
Knowledge of Postgres or Neo4j– deployment & configurations
Experience with High Availability (eg Patroni for Postgres or causal cluster for Neo4j)
Maven, Jenkins, Puppet, Ansible
What´s in it for you?
A healthy work-life balance (flexible hours, maternity/paternity and parental leave)
We support all forms of workplace environments, from using the office as a full or part time workspace with remote working within Ireland
27 days annual leave, a family-friendly work environment
We’re a diverse bunch, over 60 nationalities on-site. Expand your horizons in a rich multicultural environment with colleagues from all over the world
Clearly defined career paths, enhanced with inhouse training and financial support for external study
Dynamic 600+ member sports and social club run activities & subsidized theatre, movie, swimming tickets
Opportunities to travel around the world and work directly with our customers before they go live
Pension scheme, health insurance, company doctor, life cover and sick pay/income continuance plan
Laptop and mobile phone, tax saver commuter/bike to work scheme
Athlone is located beside a beautiful Lough Ree and is a one-hour drive from Galway or Dublin
You can also learn more about why our software campus in Athlone is a great place to work: Video Link
We also support relocation overseas for successful applicants.

We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team.

About Grouper:

With a passion for creating innovative management systems, tools, and technologies that empower organisations, Grouper has been providing its clients Governance, Risk, Compliance (GRC) and Human Capital Management solutions. Our solutions are conducted through design and implementation of cloud-based environments hosted in some of the safest Clouds available.


What is the role about:
Providing a remarkable experience for our customers is the seed from which our company has grown and we are currently branching off to an exciting niche that will disrupt GRC and HCM SaaS Industry. As an outside the box thinker, you will be working with the UX Designers to co-design, build, test and implement SaaS solutions.

As a Full-stack Developer who is passionate about innovation, challenges the status quo and has high energy levels to develop a solid foundation and technology stack and build a next-gen SaaS product that leverages Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and latest Cloud Computing technologies.


What you need to succeed:

You have a curious mind – software development is interesting, to the right mind. By typing a sequence of letters into the computer screen, one can create a beautiful, complex application that end-users will engage with in a variety of ways. SaaS Solutions are among the most complex software written, but great Full Stack Developers are curious, always wanting to learn more about the industry and about user interactions with the SaaS application.
You are a creative thinker – You are not into repeating what’s already been done before, instead, you think outside the box and leverage latest technologies including Artificial Intelligence and Machine learning, and, come up with creative solutions in order to help the SaaS product stand out from the competition.
You are master at time management – It takes strong time management skills and the ability to prioritise to ensure that everything is finished on deadline but you are a great multitasker and can constantly flit between the back end and front end to make sure the job gets done, and often have several tasks on your plate at once.
 You are meticulous – You pay great attention to detail and double or triple check to make sure your work is correct.


Required Technical Skillset examples:

You have an excellent understanding of technologies such as LAMP, LEMP, MEAN, Django , Ruby on Rails or Similar.
You have an excellent understanding of front-end technologies such as Bootstrap, JavaScript, JSON, Angular, React, TypeScript, Storybook, GraphQL, Grunt, LESS, GULP or similar.
You have an excellent understanding of back-end technologies such as PHP, ASP, .Net, Java, Python, Node, REST, Azure , Heroku, Firebase or similar.
You have an excellent understanding of design principles and a detailed knowledge of database architectures for databases such as SQL, MongoDB, MySQL and similar.
Experience of CI, CD and similar DevOps tools and practices.
Experience of Mobile App Development as well as Developing APIs and RESTful services.


Why Grouper?
Grouper is an early-stage start up that does exceptional GRC and HCM solutions that share our values. Our goal is to empower and focus so much on our people that our clients consequently get better results. But aside from our people, culture, and mission, there are a variety of additional benefits that help make Grouper a great place to work. At Grouper, one of our core values is to put people first. We want to stick to our values and commit to fostering a more diverse and inclusive culture in the digital landscape.


What are the perks?

Decide for yourself where you work most effectively whether on a Hybrid or Fully Remote Work Possibility. “Remote” can mean at home or anywhere within Ireland or Europe.
24 days paid Holiday Entitlement
Get paid for one holiday per year - Yes! As part of our work life balance policy, we pay our employees to go on a Holiday
Competitive compensation package that includes salary, benefits and bonus
VHI Healthcare
Tax Saver Travel Card for Ireland
Working with one of fast-growing start-ups and add value to the successful delivery of our services to Bluechip clients in Europe and beyond
Annual personal development budget for certifications, conferences, courses, books, career coach and similar


View more jobs at https://www.grouper.ie/careers/ Note this role is not eligible for Visa sponsorship

Senior Front-end Developer - React, Dublin (Remote)
Optum, the fast-growing part of UnitedHealth Group, is a leading information and technology-enabled health services business. Our teams are dedicated to modernizing the health care system and improving the lives of people and communities.
Serving virtually every dimension of the health system, we work with a diverse set of clients across 150 countries – from those who diagnose and treat patients to those who pay for care, deliver health services, and those who supply the cures. Optum maintains operations across North America, South America, Europe, Asia Pacific and the Middle East. Our innovative partnerships provide technology and tools that enable unprecedented collaboration and efficiency. As a result, we can tap into valuable health care data to uncover insights and develop strategies for better care at lower costs.
About the role:
We are looking for an Experienced UI developer with a proven track record of delivering UI requirements into production to lead the design, implementation and delivery of new UI features on the Emisar Analytics Gateway product. You will work alongside the UX and Product team to design new UI components for the product. You will work as part of the existing agile development team to deliver these features and integrate them with the backend dependencies. Join us! There's never been a better time to do your life's best work℠
Primary Responsibilities:
Lead the design, implementation and delivery of new UI features on the Emisar Analytics Gateway product
Work alongside the UX and Product team to design new UI components for the product
Become part of an existing Agile development team
Delivering and integrating features with the backend dependencies
You will be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role, as well as providing development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
Strong demonstrable experience using front end development and production releases
TypeScript experience
Experience using React, React Hooks, Context API and Mobile responsive
Good communication skills across external stakeholders
Redux, Redux-Saga, Redux-Toolkit experience
Ability to work a portion of monthly work hours from our Dublin or Letterkenny office is required
Assets:
Cloud experience (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Experience using Jenkins
Docker experience
Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make the health system work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.
All telecommuters will be required to adhere to the UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy

Travel Requirement Up to 10%
Company Profile:

Daon, www.daon.com, is an innovator in developing and deploying biometric authentication and identity assurance solutions worldwide. Daon has pioneered methods for securely and conveniently combining biometric and identity capabilities in multiple channels with large-scale deployments that span payments verification, digital banking, and securing borders and critical infrastructure. Daon’s solutions provide our customers with choice, making it easier and safer for people to conduct business online, travel, vote, and so much more. Daon’s IdentityX® Platform for mobile biometric authentication removes friction from the authentication process while dramatically reducing fraud to previously unattainable levels. IdentityX allows businesses to conduct transactions with any consumer at any time with total confidence. Get to know us on Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn.
Position Summary:

Supports the work of the Chief Product Officer and VeriFLY team by conducting market research, engaging with customers, gathering quantitative product data, contributing to marketing efforts, and analyzing customer research to help VeriFLY teams work more efficiently and effectively. Work on new and existing products, features, and various product strategies to support the product and company’s business goals.


Key Responsibilities:

Create and communicate business cases for roadmap and initiative / innovation investments that align with and support VeriFLY revenue growth and return on investment criteria
Converse and meet with customers and translate needs and preferences into product designs by considering market research, customer needs, competitive offerings and product development capabilities
Write high-level market requirements so that, with your support, Engineering can:
Draft Product Requirements (i.e., Use cases, user stories) and work flows which document business rules, workflow, integration, output, and product functionality that customers and prospective customers’ desire
Work with the User Experience Designer &/or other developers on the process of designing solutions for customers, including user interface prototypes. Implement existing product updates to meet the customer needs
Validate designs and prototypes with customers
Conduct research to identify customer needs and market gaps
Work with the VeriFLY team to understand product feasibility and limitations
Prepare and distribute product performance reports and training content to customers
Engage regularly with customer support teams and use real-time metrics to assess digital content strategy effectiveness
Stay abreast of industry trends and adjust the content strategy as needed
Develop marketing collateral for the product, including management of the product website
Work across business channels in promoting products to improve sales and revenue


Person Description:

You are an experienced Product Manager who is comfortable with new and cutting-edge concepts and participates in the creation of new products and features, from the idea stage to launch. To be successful in this role, you should have previous experience in end-to-end project management. Your main responsibilities include gathering product requirements, prioritizing feature implementations and improving overall user experience. Our ideal candidates should possess technical proficiency sufficient to understand technical requirements and inform application product features combined with business acumen and marketing experience. Ultimately, you’ll work with internal teams to build products that fill gaps in market and increase customer satisfaction.
Education & Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
5+ years of professional work experience in software products
Experience in creating and applying project management tools
Proven track record working cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment to lead and drive complex initiatives globally
Exceptional ability to identify improved product features and contribute to marketing strategies
Ability to balance customer needs against the company’s vision
Demonstrated ability to autonomously drive and prioritize multiple initiatives
Demonstrated ability to manage complex escalations in a timely and efficient manner, effectively balancing risks and related programmatic controls


Profile, Skills and Experience:

Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint) is preferred
Proficient in Google Analytics, Jira, Confluence, WordPress and Adobe Acrobat/Illustrator, Sketch, Figma (or similar), and BI skills
Understanding of content marketing tactics, such as SEO, digital advertising and social media marketing
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
3+ years of experience in travel, hospitality, or related industry Travel Requirement Up to 10%

Develop marketing collateral for the product, including management of the product website
Work across business channels in promoting products to improve sales and revenue


Person Description:

You are an experienced Product Manager who is comfortable with new and cutting-edge concepts and participates in the creation of new products and features, from the idea stage to launch. To be successful in this role, you should have previous experience in end-to-end project management. Your main responsibilities include gathering product requirements, prioritizing feature implementations and improving overall user experience. Our ideal candidates should possess technical proficiency sufficient to understand technical requirements and inform application product features combined with business acumen and marketing experience. Ultimately, you’ll work with internal teams to build products that fill gaps in market and increase customer satisfaction.

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience
5+ years of professional work experience in software products

Proven track record working cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment to lead and drive complex initiatives globally
Exceptional ability to identify improved product features and contribute to marketing strategies
Ability to balance customer needs against the company’s vision
Demonstrated ability to autonomously drive and prioritize multiple initiatives
Demonstrated ability to manage complex escalations in a timely and efficient manner, effectively balancing risks and related programmatic controls

Company Profile:

Daon, www.daon.com, is an innovator in developing and deploying biometric authentication and identity assurance solutions worldwide. Daon has pioneered methods for securely and conveniently combining biometric and identity capabilities in multiple channels with large-scale deployments that span payments verification, digital banking, and securing borders and critical infrastructure. Daon’s solutions provide our customers with choice, making it easier and safer for people to conduct business online, travel, vote, and so much more. Daon’s IdentityX® Platform for mobile biometric authentication removes friction from the authentication process while dramatically reducing fraud to previously unattainable levels. IdentityX allows businesses to conduct transactions with any consumer at any time with total confidence. Get to know us on Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn.

A strong ability to quickly understand complex systems and provide guidance on feature changes will be an extra bonus.


Responsibilities

Manage and plan in a fast-paced, team-focused environment; manage time and prioritize tasks and projects
