Create clear work plans and support project / programme managers to provide regular reporting on progress to management, project sponsors and steering committees
Provide functional validation and support
Perform functional setups and configurations
Define business requirements and perform gap analysis
Create and maintain process flow documentation and assistance with user training
Provide guidance to the developers on design, development, and testing

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Detailed and concise written communication and documentation skills
Ability to enable informed decision-making at all levels
Ability to facilitate effective workshops

Talent to deal successfully with ambiguity and draw out the issues to be addressed

About the Role


We work with corporations, governments and law firms to meet legal, regulatory and investigative demands by leveraging our skills to enable our clients to more confidently govern, secure, find, analyse and rapidly understand their data in the context of compliance and risk.


This role is a newly created position within our Dublin Technology practice and is a part of FTI Consulting's Technology team which encompasses about 500 experts globally. The successful candidate will be cross-trained in various e-discovery skills and will assist on all phases of e-discovery projects with primary focus on data collection, data investigation and data manipulation aspects as well as case management.


What You'll Do


The primary responsibilities of this position is to be part of a cross-functional team that manages all areas related to the collection, processing, investigation, analysis, manipulation, and management of client data within high stakes litigation, compliance, internal and regulatory investigation matters:

Assume responsibility for day-to-day data collection, processing, conversion, analysis and other specialised tasks including interaction with other consultants, supervisors, and client personnel
Create workflows and processes to solve client data problems and creatively address issues by developing novel approaches to challenges
Depending on experience, take responsibility for lab activities and junior staff training
Be customer-service-oriented and proactive to meet client deadlines while mitigating risks
Travel as required to ensure effective management of case activities (minimal notice often applicable)
Liaise with clients and other FTI colleagues to plan and execute data collection exercises, on-site at client premises in Ireland and/or abroad
Utilise industry standard and bespoke software to access, extract and cull data from electronic evidence sources

Essential Knowledge and Skills

Degree in IT or a technology focused subject such as digital forensic, information security, information systems or equivalent experience
Prior experience in the digital forensics or eDiscovery world, either in the Public sector, a private corporate or a consulting firm, with duties including hands-on data collection from individual computer, mobile device and server data sources
Extensive experience with eDiscovery platforms such as Relativity and/or Ringtail/Nuix Discover, including data processing, review support, analytics and productions
Experience with forensic tools like Encase, Cellebrite, Kali Linux, Nuix
Self-developer that demonstrates an ability to solve complex problems with well thought out innovative solutions
Ability to manage time and prioritise tasks effectively
Good communicator who can perform in a client facing role
Ability to work in a cross-functional team
Travel required to clients and to FTI office(s).


Desirable Knowledge and Skills


Prior experience with an e-discovery platform such as Relativity and/or Ringtail/Nuix Discover
SQL language skills
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Windows and related software, especially Excel
Any industry certification
Scripting skills using languages such as Python, C#, Bash or others #LI-KR2
About FTI Consulting


What makes us unique? With more than 6,250 employees located in offices in every corner of the globe, we are the firm our clients call when their most important issues are at stake. Regardless of what level you are, you will have the opportunity to work alongside and learn from top experts in your field on high-profile engagements that impact history. Our culture is collaborative, and we value diversity, recognition, development and making a difference in our communities.


FTI Consulting is publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange and has been recognized as a Best Firm to Work For by Consulting magazine and one of America's Best Management Consulting Firms by Forbes . For more information, visit www.fticonsulting.com and connect with us on Twitter ( @FTIConsulting ), Facebook and LinkedIn .

Junior Trading Architect


Is this you?

Working with architects and software developers across product engineering, this new Junior Architect role will provide support for strategic technical direction to development teams, ensuring a consistent and holistic approach to technical design across the tribe.

This role will represent architecture of product engineering focusing mainly on our Sports Trading Platforms, working with commercial and product stakeholders to ensure solutions enable our technology function to meet customer expectations in the short and long term.

This role will report into the senior Architect for Risk and Trading and require leadership across several projects and teams across the Globe, travel may be required to other locations including Dublin, Porto and Cluj.

The organisational changes with the Flutter group moving to a more global model enables exposure to many upcoming projects with a focus on standardising and simplifying the rollout of new sports models and related product with the Flutter Group now the largest player in the global sports betting space.

Candidate should be experienced and comfortable with event driven architecture, event sourcing and actor-based systems. Key technologies like kafka, containers, akka, NoSql and AWS all essential to our migration work moving legacy sports platforms to the cloud in an effort to reduce total cost of ownership while improving longer term value with faster product delivery.


What are the key responsibilities in this role?

You will work in a small senior Architecture function that oversees design across many teams
You will research and develop design and implementation approaches to harmonise across teams and sports models to enable quicker feature delivery going forward
Requires a measured approach to solution planning to balance value required today against technical debt and TCO in the future
Will have cloud experience including CICD automation leveraging advanced testing and observability
Understand SDLC and how design decisions impact cost of solutions at different parts of lifecycle
Embrace functional design approaches including streaming and immutability to limit side-effects and prioritise correctness and testability
Can balance complex stakeholder requirements with maintainability and extension concerns
Good understanding of security, networking and container deployment systems in the cloud
Harmonising the sports platform interfaces and deployment with other brands and group
Highly experienced in event driven architectures and microservices that leverage Event Streaming, Asynchronous workflows and Domain Driven Design


What are the key experiences & Qualifications Required?

Experience with complex microservice event-driven architectures
Strategic thinker who provides pragmatic solutions to business problems
Builds strong relationships with key stakeholders based on mutual respect, openness and transparency
Experience with AWS and container technologies as well as CICD design
Proven record of designing solutions to business problems, while demonstrating creativity, innovation and knowledge of best-practice design techniques.
Can work independently on large strategic programs and see outcomes to fruition
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences at all levels of the organisation
Flexible attitude and ability to meet deadlines under pressure with priority management
Collaborative approach to solving problems
Leverages Domain Driven Design to effectively scale design across teams and the org
Curious and open to learning new approaches
Ability to make decisions and lead on getting buy in on their implementation
Capable of communicating the short- and long-term impacts and benefits of these decisions


Who are we?

Paddy Power Betfair is an international sports betting and gaming operator, with a market-leading presence in the UK and Ireland, as well as a range of operations across Europe including Romania, Portugal and Malta.

We are online-led, mobile-led and sports-led: and our proprietary technology, unique products and innovative marketing all combine to offer a superb experience to our five million customers worldwide.

Our spirit, talent and ambition has taken us into the FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange and we now employ over 7,000 people in sixteen locations across the globe; from Dublin to Los Angeles, and London to Melbourne. Our culture rewards innovation, teamwork and we like to stay fast-moving in a dynamic industry.


ON A LARGER SCALE

We are part of Flutter Entertainment, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider for over thirteen million customers worldwide.

Established in 2019, Flutter merged with The Stars Group in 2020. As the parent company Flutter Entertainment now has a host of brands that sit under it including Paddy Power and Betfair (PPB), Sky Betting and Gaming, PokerStars, Timeform, OddsChecker, Sporting Life, SportsBet (in Australia), FOX Bet, TVG and FanDuel in the US.

Across the globe, Flutter employs over 14,000 people across more than 40 offices and over 600 retail sites. We pride ourselves on being a responsible operator, committed to making a positive contribution to the communities we operate within.


WHAT IS OUR CHALLENGE?

We deliver products at scale for over 5 million customers, 99,9% of transactions in less than a second
The products you'll develop will comply with ambitious uptime targets: less than 50 minutes downtime expected per year
Our systems process more than 7 million transactions every day (more than all the European stock exchanges combined)
We deliver high transitional products, serving more than 2.5Bn calls a day
We have a diverse and up to date technical landscape to explore, leverage and innovate on


WHAT ARE THE CORE COMPETENCIES REQUIRED?

Commercial acumen: Knows how the business works and how the organisation makes money and stays competitive. Encourages diverse thinking to promote and nurture innovation. Articulates credible pictures and visions of possibilities that will create sustainable value.

Ability to drive change: Talks about the future possibilities in a positive way, creates milestones and symbols to rally support behind the vision, articulates the vision in a way everyone can relate to, creates organisation wide energy and optimism for the future.

Business engagement and relationship management: Works cooperatively and partners with other across the organisation to get work done. Uses knowledge of business drivers to guide actions.

Communication: Strong communicator with a logical, structured, clear, credible and mature style. Capable of quickly engaging audiences of all levels. Not afraid to challenge senior business stakeholders, including the ExCo team, where necessary.

Big Thinker: Constantly explores and analyses future scenarios and possibilities to help the Group respond to change and shape the future; drives self and others to pursue opportunities that will create sustainable value for the Group; contributes to the flutter Group strategies, mapping and aligning efforts to strategic imperatives

Resilient: Creates a climate where people are curious, resilient, determined, learn and adapt; handles and manages crises effectively; anticipates and shows the way forward during setbacks; builds energy in others to stick with it/ to stay on track / push through.

Quality Decision Maker: Makes quality, long and short-term decisions at pace considering various inputs and through collaborating effectively; provides tools to empower teams to make decisions; regularly practices and encourages cross-functional problem solving and decision making

Nimble: Is energised by new and unfamiliar situations and quickly adapts; advocates active experimentation and encourages others to be agile in their approach; is adaptable and flexible when developing others encouraging them to learn quickly when faced with new situations and be open to new ideas and ways of working; proactively shares lessons learned across the organisation.

Wins Together: Gains trust and support of others, generous with time, advice and knowledge; is able to establish and engage networks to get stuff done rather than depend on authority; seeks out opportunities to break down barriers and collaborate and partner across organisational boundaries.

Our passion has helped us take the betting industry by storm. So we think it's only fair that you enjoy excellent rewards.

Is this you?

Working with architects and software developers across product engineering, this new Junior Architect role will provide support for strategic technical direction to development teams, ensuring a consistent and holistic approach to technical design across the tribe.

This role will represent architecture of product engineering focusing mainly on our Sports Trading Platforms, working with commercial and product stakeholders to ensure solutions enable our technology function to meet customer expectations in the short and long term.

This role will report into the senior Architect for Risk and Trading and require leadership across several projects and teams across the Globe, travel may be required to other locations including Dublin, Porto and Cluj.

The organisational changes with the Flutter group moving to a more global model enables exposure to many upcoming projects with a focus on standardising and simplifying the rollout of new sports models and related product with the Flutter Group now the largest player in the global sports betting space.

Candidate should be experienced and comfortable with event driven architecture, event sourcing and actor-based systems. Key technologies like kafka, containers, akka, NoSql and AWS all essential to our migration work moving legacy sports platforms to the cloud in an effort to reduce total cost of ownership while improving longer term value with faster product delivery.


What are the key responsibilities in this role?

You will work in a small senior Architecture function that oversees design across many teams
You will research and develop design and implementation approaches to harmonise across teams and sports models to enable quicker feature delivery going forward
Requires a measured approach to solution planning to balance value required today against technical debt and TCO in the future
Will have cloud experience including CICD automation leveraging advanced testing and observability
Understand SDLC and how design decisions impact cost of solutions at different parts of lifecycle
Embrace functional design approaches including streaming and immutability to limit side-effects and prioritise correctness and testability
Can balance complex stakeholder requirements with maintainability and extension concerns
Good understanding of security, networking and container deployment systems in the cloud
Harmonising the sports platform interfaces and deployment with other brands and group
Highly experienced in event driven architectures and microservices that leverage Event Streaming, Asynchronous workflows and Domain Driven Design


What are the key experiences & Qualifications Required?

Experience with complex microservice event-driven architectures
Strategic thinker who provides pragmatic solutions to business problems
Builds strong relationships with key stakeholders based on mutual respect, openness and transparency
Experience with AWS and container technologies as well as CICD design
Proven record of designing solutions to business problems, while demonstrating creativity, innovation and knowledge of best-practice design techniques.
Can work independently on large strategic programs and see outcomes to fruition
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences at all levels of the organisation
Flexible attitude and ability to meet deadlines under pressure with priority management
Collaborative approach to solving problems
Leverages Domain Driven Design to effectively scale design across teams and the org
Curious and open to learning new approaches
Ability to make decisions and lead on getting buy in on their implementation
Capable of communicating the short- and long-term impacts and benefits of these decisions


Who are we?

Paddy Power Betfair is an international sports betting and gaming operator, with a market-leading presence in the UK and Ireland, as well as a range of operations across Europe including Romania, Portugal and Malta.

We are online-led, mobile-led and sports-led: and our proprietary technology, unique products and innovative marketing all combine to offer a superb experience to our five million customers worldwide.

Our spirit, talent and ambition has taken us into the FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange and we now employ over 7,000 people in sixteen locations across the globe; from Dublin to Los Angeles, and London to Melbourne. Our culture rewards innovation, teamwork and we like to stay fast-moving in a dynamic industry.


ON A LARGER SCALE

We are part of Flutter Entertainment, a global sports betting, gaming and entertainment provider for over thirteen million customers worldwide.

Established in 2019, Flutter merged with The Stars Group in 2020. As the parent company Flutter Entertainment now has a host of brands that sit under it including Paddy Power and Betfair (PPB), Sky Betting and Gaming, PokerStars, Timeform, OddsChecker, Sporting Life, SportsBet (in Australia), FOX Bet, TVG and FanDuel in the US.

Across the globe, Flutter employs over 14,000 people across more than 40 offices and over 600 retail sites. We pride ourselves on being a responsible operator, committed to making a positive contribution to the communities we operate within.


WHAT IS OUR CHALLENGE?

We deliver products at scale for over 5 million customers, 99,9% of transactions in less than a second
The products you'll develop will comply with ambitious uptime targets: less than 50 minutes downtime expected per year
Our systems process more than 7 million transactions every day (more than all the European stock exchanges combined)
We deliver high transitional products, serving more than 2.5Bn calls a day
We have a diverse and up to date technical landscape to explore, leverage and innovate on


WHAT ARE THE CORE COMPETENCIES REQUIRED?

Commercial acumen: Knows how the business works and how the organisation makes money and stays competitive. Encourages diverse thinking to promote and nurture innovation. Articulates credible pictures and visions of possibilities that will create sustainable value.

Ability to drive change: Talks about the future possibilities in a positive way, creates milestones and symbols to rally support behind the vision, articulates the vision in a way everyone can relate to, creates organisation wide energy and optimism for the future.

Business engagement and relationship management: Works cooperatively and partners with other across the organisation to get work done. Uses knowledge of business drivers to guide actions.

Communication: Strong communicator with a logical, structured, clear, credible and mature style. Capable of quickly engaging audiences of all levels. Not afraid to challenge senior business stakeholders, including the ExCo team, where necessary.

Big Thinker: Constantly explores and analyses future scenarios and possibilities to help the Group respond to change and shape the future; drives self and others to pursue opportunities that will create sustainable value for the Group; contributes to the flutter Group strategies, mapping and aligning efforts to strategic imperatives

Resilient: Creates a climate where people are curious, resilient, determined, learn and adapt; handles and manages crises effectively; anticipates and shows the way forward during setbacks; builds energy in others to stick with it/ to stay on track / push through.

Quality Decision Maker: Makes quality, long and short-term decisions at pace considering various inputs and through collaborating effectively; provides tools to empower teams to make decisions; regularly practices and encourages cross-functional problem solving and decision making

Nimble: Is energised by new and unfamiliar situations and quickly adapts; advocates active experimentation and encourages others to be agile in their approach; is adaptable and flexible when developing others encouraging them to learn quickly when faced with new situations and be open to new ideas and ways of working; proactively shares lessons learned across the organisation.

Wins Together: Gains trust and support of others, generous with time, advice and knowledge; is able to establish and engage networks to get stuff done rather than depend on authority; seeks out opportunities to break down barriers and collaborate and partner across organisational boundaries.


What You'll Get in Return...

Our passion has helped us take the betting industry by storm. So we think it's only fair that you enjoy excellent rewards.

This is a Hybrid role based out of Citywest, Dublin.
Who are we looking for:
Uniphar are embarking on an ambitious, multi-year IT transformation program and are seeking an experienced contract Business Analyst to work across one or more of our transformation initiatives. Operating within PMO, the Business Analyst will be supported within the wider technology transformation program by Commercial, Operations, HR, Group IT, PMO and business change functions. The Business Analyst will be expected to lead the analysis phase of one or more projects, capturing the overall requirements on behalf of the business, working with technology teams and 3rd party vendors as required, and support the overall delivery lifecycle of the project as required.
Key Responsibilities / Outcomes
Working with business owners, project managers, technology, vendors and multiple stakeholders, lead the analysis phase of one or more projects to ensure the requirements of the business are translated into clear documented asks using appropriate frameworks.
Facilitate requirements gathering sessions, build consensus and document accordingly in line with the delivery methodology in place and the schedule as set by the project manager. Understand and deliver on the customers needs, collaborate with business stakeholders to ensure requirements are documented and agreed.
Translate business requirements to the delivery team, collaboratively produce design specifications, work to ensure the solutions designed meet the business requirements, present back outcomes to the business stakeholders. Deliver complex process mapping of AS IS and TO Be processes as required to support business change processes, technical process mapping to support the delivery teams, or as required to manage the change program. Pivotal member of the change management process and bringing our stakeholders through the change journey.
Support the team during the delivery lifecycle required in areas such as business readiness, testing, support and training.
Contribute in relevant planning, status updates, and governance as appropriate. Provide estimations for work, work to a schedule, escalate any observations to the project manager.
Support any data migration process – deliver clear data dictionaries from each legacy IT system, map to new systems, and oversee migration, cleansing, testing and loading into new systems as required.
Contribute at a program level in areas such as cross workstream dependencies and multi system integrations.
Key Skills, Experiences & Competencies
10+ years implementing technology solutions for complex business problems in an FMCG environment.
The ideal candidate should be comfortable operating in waterfall and agile environments and can transition between methodologies as appropriate depending on the project or product.
Excellent documentation skills, process mapping, user requirements specifications, functional specifications, requirements traceability matrices, feature and story writing.
Substantial commercial acumen, the Business Analyst will be immersed in the business for long periods and must be comfortable operating across different divisions and departments.
Comfortable working with 3rd party vendors to design solutions, developers, reasonable knowledge of design patterns and application architecture.
Attention to detail, must be able to operate at the relevant levels of detail required to ensure successful delivery.
Self-starter with strong communication, presentation, relationship building and end to end analytical skills.
Strong data analysis skills, interpreting information, cleansing and data transformation, use of excel, SQL and database querying tools an advantage.
Prior experience working in a GxP environment useful.
Experience in implementing some of the following – ERP, WMS, CRM, eCommerce, digital portals, mobile apps, reporting tools.
Relevant Business Analysis certifications a plus.
Who we are
Uniphar Group is a rapidly expanding diversified healthcare services business with a global footprint and a proud heritage in Ireland.Since Uniphar became a publicly listed company in 2019, the Group has grown organically and through a series of strategic acquisitions, which continue to strengthen Uniphar’s international reach.
Uniphar provides outsourced and specialised services to its clients, leveraging the strong relationships with 200+ of the world’s best known pharmaco-medical manufacturers across multiple geographies, enabled by our cutting-edge digital technology and our expert teams. Uniphar is organised into three key divisions: Supply Chain & Retail, Commercial & Clinical (Med Tech / Pharma) and Product Access.
With a workforce of close to 3,500 spread across Ireland, United Kingdom, the Netherlands, the Nordics, Germany and the USA, Uniphar is a trusted global partner to Pharma and MedTech manufacturers, working to improve patient access to medicines and treatments around the world.
Culture at Uniphar
We pride ourselves in being truly entrepreneurial, innovative, collaborative, with a strong problem-solving ethos.We have built working relationships which span decades with many of the world’s largest Pharma and MedTech companies. We believe that this is because we know how to build a relationship of trust with our partners - we put our customers and their patients at the heart of what we do and treat them with integrity and respect. Everything Uniphar does is enabled by our people. As we continue to grow domestically and internationally, we become more diverse.This rich diversity fuels our business and enriches our culture. This is a Hybrid role based out of Citywest, Dublin.

PHP, Backend, Software Developer, Laravel, Remote
I am currently working with a Dublin based marketing company who are expanding their backend team. They have been in business for the past 10 years and have continued to grow with offices across Ireland and mainland Europe. The company are trying to change the online advertisement industry through their platform and are now looking for talented backend developers to help design and build their platforms across mobile and web projects.

The backend team are working with PHP, with no framework currently in use, but plans to migrate to Laravel for up-coming projects. Previous Laravel, or any PHP framework experience, will prove beneficial for this role. The role is fully remote within Ireland and does not require going into the office.

5+ years' experience with PHP
Knowledge and experience with SQL, MySQL
Knowledge and experience with JS
Exposure and understanding with PHP frameworks
Experience with a range of testing
Experience with HTML, CSS
Desirable:
Experience in Go
Experience with Laravel
Salary and Benefits:
Health Insurance
Learning opportunities
60-65k

Previous Laravel, or any PHP framework experience, will prove beneficial for this role. The role is fully remote within Ireland and does not require going into the office.

What are they looking for?
5+ years' experience with PHP
Knowledge and experience with SQL, MySQL
Knowledge and experience with JS
Exposure and understanding with PHP frameworks
Experience with a range of testing
Experience with HTML, CSS
Desirable:
Experience in Go
Experience with Laravel
Salary and Benefits:
Health Insurance
Learning opportunities
60-65k

Do you enjoy working on end-to-end solutions using leading development and optimization practices? Are you looking for an opportunity that will drive your career in new & exciting ways? This job is for you! Our client, a global professional services company, are looking for an iOS Developer to join their SCRUM team.

As an iOS Developer you will be responsible for:
Forging leading solutions designs and driving implementation approaches for successful technology solutions.
Working on multiple client-orientated projects within an Agile or Waterfall development environment.
Collaborating in an iOS SCRUM team using Apple iOS / SWIFT.
Operate in end-to-end solutions, varying from understanding business requirements, defining design patterns, to driving the end-state delivery and support using leading development and optimisation practices.

Ideally, you will have:
Ability to bring value to our clients in innovative ways. You can tell a great story about it!
5+ years’ experience in designing and delivering custom engineering applications in a client-facing environment.
Experience in leading end-to-end mobile solutions using software security best practices.
Strong collaboration skills. You can not only work in a team, but you can also coach and mentor team members to be their best!
Some nice extras:
Experience with mobile application platforms and development eg. KONY platform, API development, frontend development.
Engagement based consulting experience or equivalent industry experience.
Industry-relevant certifications (including Cloud certifications).

Our client offers a competitive basic salary as well as an extensive benefits package which includes gym subsidy, private medical insurance & extra days leave per year for charitable work of your choice!

LiveTiles is an Australian owned, fast growing Employee Experience (EX) company, headquartered in Melbourne, with teams across the US, APAC, and EMEA regions.
We believe that the world is a better place when humans are free to do their best work. We create and deliver EX technology for companies of all sizes to connect their employees to everything they need at work for a more personal, productive, and purposeful experience. From complex digital workplaces to quick-to-deploy mobile apps our solutions help connect your people to the very best employee experiences.
Our Culture:
Great things happen when people connect. We live for employee experience – where people are deeply connected to their company’s purpose, brand and vision, and where they are enabled to perform at their best and are happy and healthy at work and in life.
Our awesome culture is built around 3 core values; We are decent human beings, we get Sh!t done, and we create unforgettable experiences. Our employees are spread across the world, we offer flexible work conditions, and we support one another through collaborative practices and social connections.
So, let’s connect!
Your Mission:
LiveTiles is hiring a full-time Software Developer who loves building components in React, polishing visuals in CSS, and making sure projects deliver on-time. Are you someone with experience building complex client-side web applications in the browser and delivering user experiences, and are you looking to join a close-knit team comprised of highly talented, passionate, and collaborative people?
Responsibilities
Develop software with best practice engineering principles.
Designs and development of new solutions and enhancements using frontend and backend technology.
Work on maintenance and enhancements in existing product features.
Applying object-oriented programming standards to application development.
Work effectively as part of a product team, demonstrating a willingness to provide ideas and solutions to design-orientated problems.
Ensuring quality through automated functional testing, performance testing, and regular code reviews.
Collaboration with fellow team members inside a highly agile environment while working within a small team.
Be a team player with a can-do-attitude excited to work in a fast-paced global environment.
Qualifications
Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in a Computer Science or related field with 5 years of work experience.
Professional experience in Front-end and back-end development using with .Net /C#, Rest-based API, JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, as well as frameworks like Angular, Vue and React.
Experience with developing, troubleshooting, and deploying web applications utilizing Front-end UI libraries. i.e., CSS with SASS, jQuery.
Experience with Azure DevOps or other code repositories.
Experience Participating in Agile Scrum teams.
Nice to have Experience with Cloud-based technologies including Azure and SharePoint online.
Open to learn cloud native technologies (Docker, Kubernetes), distributed/serverless architectures, and microservices with micro-frontends architectures.
Open-minded and can work with a multitude of individuals.
Good written/oral language skills in English.
Now that you've got the details, here's some additional perks that make LiveTiles a great place to work:
EX days - Take some time to try a new experience
Volunteer days - We encourage you to give back to the community
Career growth - We want to help you grow with us
Access to senior leadership to share your ideas – We don’t like red tape!
Hybrid workplace - Flexibility to alternate
Did we mention great team mates?

LiveTiles is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate because of your race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, civil status, veteran status, or disability status. Our recruitment practices promote true accountability. We are committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives.

GHaz1CjrdI Show more

Frontend Developer


Who are we?

Paddy Power Betfair (PPB) is an international sports betting and gaming operator with a market-leading presence in the UK and Ireland, as well as a range of operations across Europe including Romania, Portugal, and Malta.

By combining an online-led, mobile-led and sports-led philosophy with our proprietary technology, unique products and innovative marketing, we offer a superb experience to our five million customers worldwide.

As part of the Flutter Entertainment group which includes a host of other brands including Sky Betting and Gaming, PokerStars, Timeform, OddsChecker, Sporting Life, SportsBet (in Australia), FOX Bet, TVG and FanDuel in the US, we are part of a global brand employing over 14,000 people in more than 40 offices and 600 retail sites. As well as being a great place to work we pride ourselves on being a responsible operator, committed to making a positive contribution to the communities that we operate in.


What is our challenge (Fast, Resilient, Accurate)?

We deliver products at scale for over 5 million customers
99.9% of transactions in less than a second
Our products are resilient with less than 50 minutes downtime expected per year
The outputs of our products must be accurate, so we employ Continuous Integration, Continuous Testing and Continuous Deployment


What is the Team- set up?
Our team is a highly motivated development group, working on the global delivery of trading applications. We are a highly collaborative, fast-moving bunch, operating with a DevOps mindset. More importantly we enjoy what we do and have fun doing it. Our developers work closely with our Data Science teams to deploy Machine Learning models at scale across our business. To do this we are building reusable componentry to cover all manner of requests that empower our users to deploy and test innovative solutions as quickly as possible in real world scenarios. We use the best tool for the job and are not constrained by language choice (Java, Scala, C# and python are all in use) and our preference is to host on the cloud as it gives us the gives us access to the power that we need to run our applications.

We love streaming and our default is real-time processing. This does bring its challenges, but we don't shy away from a problem because it's hard. If we can do it the right way, we will.


What can I expect from the role?

Our Developers know their stuff – they're busy working autonomously and setting high standards. That's why we're gearing them up towards a seamless role evolution.
As a Frontend Developer you are part of a Software development team and you'll analyze requirements provided by the team's Product Owner, design and develop technical solutions or processes, do unit testing, maintain and improve production code, contribute to the performance improvement work, keep the projects technical documentation up to date, while minimizing manual processes and providing automated solutions.
Reporting to a Delivery Manager in a remote team formed by 4 to 5 Developers and 1 QA, you will use technology as a basis to deliver amazing value to our customers, while scaling our platform to meet the demands of worldwide markets.


What are the key responsibilities of this role?

Develop software as part of an agile team with short iterations and frequent releases
Contribute to planning and the subsequent development of applications
Remain up-to-date in terms of current and future needed upgrades


What is the key experience & qualifications I need in this role?

Awareness / experience in using agile methodologies
Professional experience building high quality, performant JavaScript applications
JavaScript frameworks/libraries, such as React/Redux
JavaScript test tools (e.g. Mocha, Jasmine, Jest, Protractor, Selenium)
Packaging/build tools (e.g. NPM, Webpack, Grunt, Gulp)
Test-driven development techniques (e.g. BDD and ATDD)
Automated testing and mocking techniques
Clean coding
Experience of using established design patterns


What are the nice to haves?

TypeScript
AWS CDK
Event Streaming/Message-based systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ)


Key skills & attributes

Passion for building a great consumer product that our customers will love
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to interact effectively with other functional teams
Ability to work in fast paced, team oriented environment
Flexible, ability to adapt to changing priorities and rapid change
Excellent communicator, common sense and a passion for the art of problem solving


What Will I Get in Return?
A competitive salary
Uncapped Holiday Allowance - Yes, you heard that right - UNCAPPED holiday!
A self-development fund of €1,000 per year to spend on your learning
Flexible Working - We have a host of flexible working options that are available to you.
We are part of a global company with offices on four continents. We offer the opportunity to work with people and teams in these offices and the possibility to work from those locations for a period or permanently.
We are part of a large diverse global company, and we encourage and support people to move to distinct roles or parts of the company to further their career development aspirations.


The Fun Stuff in our benefits includes an annual Target bonus, Health & Wellbeing, with free classes such a yoga, boot camp, Brazilian jiu-jitsu, running & cycling clubs among others and a hybrid working model between home and office working.


The Boring but necessary stuff in our benefits package includes a Subsidised canteen, Pension/Flexible Financial Wellbeing, Private health insurance, Life assurance & Income protection.


If the above is of interest, and you have the skills and experience, click apply now! Thanks. Frontend Developer


Who are we?

Paddy Power Betfair (PPB) is an international sports betting and gaming operator with a market-leading presence in the UK and Ireland, as well as a range of operations across Europe including Romania, Portugal, and Malta.

By combining an online-led, mobile-led and sports-led philosophy with our proprietary technology, unique products and innovative marketing, we offer a superb experience to our five million customers worldwide.

As part of the Flutter Entertainment group which includes a host of other brands including Sky Betting and Gaming, PokerStars, Timeform, OddsChecker, Sporting Life, SportsBet (in Australia), FOX Bet, TVG and FanDuel in the US, we are part of a global brand employing over 14,000 people in more than 40 offices and 600 retail sites. As well as being a great place to work we pride ourselves on being a responsible operator, committed to making a positive contribution to the communities that we operate in.


What is our challenge (Fast, Resilient, Accurate)?

We deliver products at scale for over 5 million customers
99.9% of transactions in less than a second
Our products are resilient with less than 50 minutes downtime expected per year
The outputs of our products must be accurate, so we employ Continuous Integration, Continuous Testing and Continuous Deployment


What is the Team- set up?
Our team is a highly motivated development group, working on the global delivery of trading applications. We are a highly collaborative, fast-moving bunch, operating with a DevOps mindset. More importantly we enjoy what we do and have fun doing it. Our developers work closely with our Data Science teams to deploy Machine Learning models at scale across our business. To do this we are building reusable componentry to cover all manner of requests that empower our users to deploy and test innovative solutions as quickly as possible in real world scenarios. We use the best tool for the job and are not constrained by language choice (Java, Scala, C# and python are all in use) and our preference is to host on the cloud as it gives us the gives us access to the power that we need to run our applications.

We love streaming and our default is real-time processing. This does bring its challenges, but we don't shy away from a problem because it's hard. If we can do it the right way, we will.


What can I expect from the role?

Our Developers know their stuff – they're busy working autonomously and setting high standards. That's why we're gearing them up towards a seamless role evolution.
As a Frontend Developer you are part of a Software development team and you'll analyze requirements provided by the team's Product Owner, design and develop technical solutions or processes, do unit testing, maintain and improve production code, contribute to the performance improvement work, keep the projects technical documentation up to date, while minimizing manual processes and providing automated solutions.
Reporting to a Delivery Manager in a remote team formed by 4 to 5 Developers and 1 QA, you will use technology as a basis to deliver amazing value to our customers, while scaling our platform to meet the demands of worldwide markets.


What are the key responsibilities of this role?

Develop software as part of an agile team with short iterations and frequent releases
Contribute to planning and the subsequent development of applications
Remain up-to-date in terms of current and future needed upgrades


What is the key experience & qualifications I need in this role?

Awareness / experience in using agile methodologies
Professional experience building high quality, performant JavaScript applications
JavaScript frameworks/libraries, such as React/Redux
JavaScript test tools (e.g. Mocha, Jasmine, Jest, Protractor, Selenium)
Packaging/build tools (e.g. NPM, Webpack, Grunt, Gulp)
Test-driven development techniques (e.g. BDD and ATDD)
Automated testing and mocking techniques
Clean coding
Experience of using established design patterns


What are the nice to haves?

TypeScript
AWS CDK
Event Streaming/Message-based systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ)


Key skills & attributes

Passion for building a great consumer product that our customers will love
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to interact effectively with other functional teams
Ability to work in fast paced, team oriented environment
Flexible, ability to adapt to changing priorities and rapid change
Excellent communicator, common sense and a passion for the art of problem solving


What Will I Get in Return?
A competitive salary
Uncapped Holiday Allowance - Yes, you heard that right - UNCAPPED holiday!
A self-development fund of €1,000 per year to spend on your learning
Flexible Working - We have a host of flexible working options that are available to you.
We are part of a global company with offices on four continents. We offer the opportunity to work with people and teams in these offices and the possibility to work from those locations for a period or permanently.
We are part of a large diverse global company, and we encourage and support people to move to distinct roles or parts of the company to further their career development aspirations.


The Fun Stuff in our benefits includes an annual Target bonus, Health & Wellbeing, with free classes such a yoga, boot camp, Brazilian jiu-jitsu, running & cycling clubs among others and a hybrid working model between home and office working.


The Boring but necessary stuff in our benefits package includes a Subsidised canteen, Pension/Flexible Financial Wellbeing, Private health insurance, Life assurance & Income protection.

In this Digital Project Manager position, you will manage marketing engagement channel programs for one of Media Monk's top tier clients. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to help define our processes and work to deliver high-quality marketing campaigns and content through well-managed, on time and on budget projects. Our ideal candidate is a fast and flexible go-getter who jumps on new opportunities, with a natural aptitude for collaboration. Sound like you? Let's get acquainted!

What You'll Do:

Build and launch marketing campaigns that live across devices on desktop, mobile and app
Develop campaigns with the account and creative team based on client brief (text copy, image assets, audience targeting)
Track required delivery dates of campaign components (e.g., targeting definitions, creative elements, legal approvals)
Flag any missing components that jeopardise launch dates, and work with the appropriate teams to track down the missing components
Review campaigns for compatibility within the policy guidelines and concurrently running campaigns. Work with YouTube contacts to resolve any conflicts
Confirm campaigns launch on time and as specified by client. Flag any unexpected results for review by client
Provide weekly basic campaign performance analysis (click-through rates, conversion rates) for recently launched and ended campaigns.
Maintain a master calendar of all marketing-driven campaigns
Manage constantly changing project priorities, timelines, and deliverables, proactively communicating updates across teams
Track project changes and their impact on the cost/time frame of project delivery
Review project hours burn reports for program accuracy and risks
Support strategies for risk mitigation and contingency planning
Ensure project documents are complete, current, and stored appropriately on the server
Serve as the main lead and client point-of-contact on certain projects

Who we're looking for:

College degree and 4+ years of experience in a digital media role, working closely with cross functional teams (i.e. account managers, art directors, developers) and clients
Experience in marketing campaign execution (e.g. media, email) and understanding of performance metrics
Project timeline development and management skills
Ability to manage multiple complex projects simultaneously
Comfortable in fast-paced environment, navigating uncertainty and prioritizing when needed
Good written and verbal communication skills
Ability to work as well independently as within a team
Creative agency experience a plus
High energy and go-getter attitude; comfortable working autonomously
Proficient in Google Suite: Drive, Docs, Slides, Sheets or equivalent (e.g., Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
Comfortable dealing with ambiguity
Sense of humour and strong team orientation
Need someone with a high attention to detail and eager to learn

About Media.Monks:

Media.Monks is on a mission to create a new future for this industry. Our vision? Build everything with a belief that changing for good comes from changing who does the work. Yep, that means you. Welcome to the party—one global, cross-cultural collective with a passion for using our skills to create better and a better world. That's how we're able to connect the dots between data, content, digital media, and technology from everywhere we are—a true end-to-end model. Joining the Media.Monks collective means having the opportunity to create award-winning work with some of the most gifted, focused, joyful, talents from all over the world.

At Media.Monks, you'll be joining a highly ambitious company on a global mission to win the decade by changing the industry for good. Partner to 8 of the 10 most innovative companies in the world, Media.Monks works with established as well as up-and-coming global, regional, DTC and B2B brands, helping them own their data and build out customer ecosystems to elicit smart, efficient, high-impact engines for growth. We deliver table stakes quickly, creating cost efficiencies from day one to push up the creative effectiveness of our work with every cycle.

We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents—and resonates with—the world around us. Mobile Developer, Android, iOS, Backend, Lead

I am currently working with a Dublin based company who are looking for a lead mobile developer to join their team. The company are looking for an experienced mobile developer to help build their team - as they are currently working with only 1 developer on the team. The project will involve working closely alongside the other developers to ensure the successful launch of the new products. Experience as a lead developer is required for this role, or least a few years in a senior position, mentoring juniors.

The company have been in operation for over ten years, operating in a start-up environment, and are now looking for a driven developer who will be able to help build the mobile team over the next 12-months.

What are they looking for?
5+ years' experience working with Android
Experience with Kotlin and Java
Experience and Knowledge with iOS
Experience working with Third-Party APIs
Experience with releasing apps on Play Store
Experience with Android Frameworks
Experience leading a mobile team
Desirable:
Experience in a start-up environment
Relevant third level degree
Salary & Benefits:
Remote
Pension
Healthcare

Ryanair Holdings plc, Europe’s largest airline group, is the parent company of Buzz, Lauda, Malta Air & Ryanair DAC. Carrying over 153 m guests p.a. on more than 2,400 daily flights from 86 bases, the group connects over 200 destinations in 40 countries on a fleet of over 475 aircraft, with a further 210 Boeing 737’s on order, which will enable the Ryanair Group to lower fares and grow traffic to 200m p.a. by FY24. Ryanair has a team of over 19,000 highly skilled aviation professionals delivering Europe’s No.1 on-time performance, and an industry leading 34-year safety record. Ryanair is Europe’s greenest cleanest airline group and customers switching to fly Ryanair can reduce their CO₂ emissions by up to 50% compared to the other Big 4 EU major airlines
The Department
Ryanair Labs is the technology brand of Ryanair, a tech start up within a legacy airline. Our digital hubs are located in Dublin, Madrid, and Wroclaw. With big plans to digitally revolutionise the travel industry, Ryanair Labs has embarked on its mission to become the Amazon of Travel with an encompassing Trip's platform.
Ryanair Labs is dedicated to hiring top IT talent, where software developers can have the freedom to work on game changing projects that will have an impact on our business from day one.
The Team
Our Frontend development team is made up of almost 30 Javascript and Angular Specialists working across 15 independent teams. These delivery focused project pods work on the Ryanair website, mobile application, Ryanair Rooms website, and internal applications. Our continuous delivery approach means we follow the Agile Scrum methodology.
The Role
We are looking for talented front-end developers to join our digital development team. In this role you will work closely with our development and product team to develop, modify and support our website and user interfaces across all channels. We want someone who is motivated by emerging technologies and has a passion to drive digital transformation. A real desire to work in a collaborative and fast-paced retail environment is essential. You will be joining Ryanair at an exciting time with an ambitious roadmap to become digital leaders and pioneers.
These positions are permanent based in our Dublin offices. We are offering Sponsorship and Relocation packages.
Responsibilities
Delivering best-in-class user interfaces across the Ryanair.com platform
Developing high quality, testable and performance software using agile practices
Driving best technology and software development practices in the team with passion and enthusiasm
Assisting analysts and business stakeholders in shaping, estimating and planning new requirements
Participating in regular showcases of new work to the product owners and business stakeholders
Striving for continuous improvement within the team

Requirements
Proficient in HTML/CSS (preferably with HTML5 and CSS3 experience)
Professional experience in Angular framework.
Comfortable coding custom JavaScript solutions as well as utilising existing frameworks
Commercial experience with Backbone/Angular technologies
Expert knowledge of building high performing and available websites and how to apply page performance optimisation techniques
Adept at building and maintaining cross browser/device compatible sites
Exposure or appreciation of agile development practices
Comfortable with revision control systems (Mercurial)
Passionate about user experience
Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Excellent understanding of the coding standards required for high volume websites from a security and performance perspective
Experience of working with large ecommerce websites and their underlying databases.
IT Bachelor’s degree or equivalent industry experience
2- -3 years’ experience in a fast paced commercial environment
Benefits
Competitive Salary - Including Airline Benefits. Ryanair Holdings plc, Europe’s largest airline group, is the parent company of Buzz, Lauda, Malta Air & Ryanair DAC. Carrying over 153 m guests p.a. on more than 2,400 daily flights from 86 bases, the group connects over 200 destinations in 40 countries on a fleet of over 475 aircraft, with a further 210 Boeing 737’s on order, which will enable the Ryanair Group to lower fares and grow traffic to 200m p.a. by FY24. Ryanair has a team of over 19,000 highly skilled aviation professionals delivering Europe’s No.1 on-time performance, and an industry leading 34-year safety record. Ryanair is Europe’s greenest cleanest airline group and customers switching to fly Ryanair can reduce their CO₂ emissions by up to 50% compared to the other Big 4 EU major airlines

The Mainframe Team within the Environment Management Services department is responsible for the maintenance and operation of mainframe environments and configuration across the Bank of Ireland non-production mainframe estate. The team work closely with colleagues supporting strategic web and mobile applications, application development teams across the Bank, and with external partners in mainframe platform support.The Mainframe Software Engineer will have a range of responsibilities including but not limited to:Responding to support requests received from EMS Customers diligently and effectivelyContributing to and the documentation of service delivery methods – “how to” guides, FAQsUsing and extending existing tools for automation and service improvementPartnering with the other teams within EMS to resolve incidents and improve service availabilityThe successful candidate will be flexible in their working arrangements, able to work either India or Ireland hours as required.The successful applicant will:hold a Batchelor’s degree in the IT field;be passionate about service improvement through the development of automation and scripts;possess good written and verbal communication and comprehension skills and excellent technical troubleshooting & problem solving skills;be able to work independently with minimal supervision;evidence 5+ years’ experience in a similar role;Strong Hands on Experience in Engineering change in some / all of : CICS, Cobol, JCL, DB2, IMS;Experience in both Batch and Online application development;Familiar with the following tools: Endevor, Fileaid, TSO, Why work for us:
At Vodafone, we’re working hard to build a better future A more connected, more inclusive, and more sustainable world. We believe technology is only as powerful as the people using it to create a better tomorrow:
Role Purpose
The Data Centre Services Manager is responsible for all datacentre strategy and datacentre customer and supplier coordination with Vodafone teams. This extends across all functional areas required to maintain a great customer experience as well the efficient management of datacentre related internal activities e.g. Finance, Supply chain, Account management, Corporate Security, Strategy etc.
You will have significant experience operating with multi-disciplinary teams and extensive experience managing supplier contracts, supplier negotiation, understanding technical activities across mechanical & electrical, datacentre design, cooling and operations.
You will be tasked with ensuring that all customer related processes are fit for purpose and that all datacentre related internal, partner and customer communications are of a high standard appropriate to the specific audience. This includes responsibility for getting audience specific communications out to all the relevant parties.
You will be capable of managing customer expectations and will have responsibility for providing them with information and issue resolution as it pertains to Datacentre related services.
You will be capable of presenting to the most senior levels of the organisation as a subject matter expert and developer of strategy for the data centre pillar.

You will be capable of managing customer expectations and will have responsibility for providing them with information and issue resolution as it pertains to Datacentre related services.
You will be capable of presenting to the most senior levels of the organisation as a subject matter expert and developer of strategy for the data centre pillar.
Long Description
When you join the Vodafone Team, you will have the chance to grow your career while also experiencing some serious benefits!
Some of the benefits that you will receive along the way are:
Competitive Salary
Flexible working (times and location) is part of our culture where your hours can facilitate your personal work-life balance
Generous Employer Pension contribution
Free Phone Bill – When you join the team, your phone bill is on us! You will also receive mobile phone purchasing discounts
Learning and Development – We provide extensive training to all of our employees so they can progress in their careers! There is also the Vodafone University where our employees can gain incredible skills!
Exclusive Family and Friends Discounts – Receive additional discounts for you, your Family and Friends on Vodafone Products!
23 days annual leave and 3 charity days off – PLUS a dedicated day off for your birthday
Free Parking
Access to our Wellness centre including free access to our Gym, health and wellness centre and external practitioners
We are passionate about our employees! Here at Vodafone we want you to bring your whole self to work and we enable this with our progressive workplace policies. We are proud supporters of the LGBTQ+ community and Vodafone is committed to support all of their employees at work. We are an equal opportunities employer where our people can be at their best.
When you combine Technology and the human spirit, anything is possible. And when you join Vodafone, we’ll help you shape a rewarding career that gives back in more ways than one. Its starts here. It starts with you.

My client is a Mobile Ethnography platform that enhances users to create a virtual experience in Cork.
This company is very much still within its early stages of development and they are looking for hungry & like-minded Developers to join their operation.
Key Experience:
2 - 3 years experience as a front end developer
An understanding of the principles of computer science, mathematics
Proven understanding of modern frontend development
Excellent communication skills
Strong problem-solving ability
The ability to write readable, testable, maintainable, performant object-oriented code
The ability to apply modern testing and quality practises, so that we can deploy your code safely at scale
A disciplined approach to testing and quality assurance
The ability to evolve rapidly and be flexible to the shifting needs of a fast growing business
The ability to work collaboratively and share knowledge, as well as communicating the detail of issues and progress to assist the team improve as a collective.
Read, analyse, and understand the requirements documentation for each of the software features
Develop user-facing applications using react.js
Build modular and reusable components and libraries
Optimise web applications for performance
Keep an eye on the security aspects of the web applications
Perform code reviews of web application components produced by other team members
Address any defects identified in the web applications
Attend and provide input in all Scrum meetings
Qualification:
Degree in Computer Science or equivalent (significant industry experience may be considered in Lieu of a degree)
Technologies used:
Strong proficiency working with React, Webpack, flux, redux, HTML, CSS
Experience with CI/CD pipelines
DevOps or Jira Software for defect tracking, ticket logging and bug tracking
Experience working on modern frontend technologies
Knowledge of Docker / AWS is considered advantageous
Desirable if you have
Experience with Kubernetes
GCS Computer Recruitment Services is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy. My client is a Mobile Ethnography platform that enhances users to create a virtual experience in Cork.
This company is very much still within its early stages of development and they are looking for hungry & like-minded Developers to join their operation.
Key Experience:
2 - 3 years experience as a front end developer

Work at the forefront of automotive innovation with ZF,
one of the world’s leading automotive suppliers.
Senior Frontend Developer (m/f/d)
Location:
Dublin, IE, D02 AE12
Req ID 41645 Dublin, Ireland
ZF is a global technology company supplying systems for passenger cars, commercial vehicles and industrial technology, enabling the next generation of mobility. ZF allows vehicles to see, think and act. In the four technology domains of Vehicle Motion Control, Integrated Safety, Automated Driving, and Electric Mobility, ZF offers comprehensive product and software solutions for established vehicle manufacturers and newly emerging transport and mobility service providers. With its products and its more than 150,000 employees around the world, ZF contributes to reducing emissions, protecting the climate and enhancing safe mobility.

We are currently looking for skilled people that want to have an impact with their work to join a newly formed ZF Aftermarket Product Engineering team in our existing Dublin office. Over the next 12 months, this team will be working to bring a new customer-facing platform from concept to production through a deeply collaborative effort between our engineering, UX, Product and Data members. The team will leverage the company's existing knowledge of both the industry and technologies to create a digital product that will help reduce CO2 emissions of fleets, improve road safety and provide predictability and value to its customers. This is a unique opportunity to have an early and significant impact on shaping both the new engineering organization and product while having the security of being part of one of the world's largest automotive suppliers.

About the Senior Front-End Developer:
As a Senior Front-End developer you be part of a small highly skilled, innovative and motivated development team in the construction and exploitation of new digital solutions for fleets, developed using cutting-edge technologies in web application and cloud computing. You will be working closely with the product team and senior Front-End developers, to build responsive, data-centric rich web applications, using the latest JavaScript frameworks. You must possess a flair for User Experience and a passion for producing state-of-the-art user interfaces

Your tasks:
Designing and building applications based on React
Provide Technical Leadership toward best practices and patterns when working with React
Work closely with Product and the team's UX designer to build products from proof of concept through to production.
Building high-performance responsive applications
Write unit/integration tests as part of CICD pipelines

Your profile:
Computer Science degree or equivalent
8+ years of software development experience
Strong proficiency in JavaScript & CSS
Working knowledge of CI/CD pipelines in GitLab/GitHub
Expertise in TDD, Jest or React testing libraries is advantageous.
Experience with client automation tools
Working with the full stack
Interest/experience with Mobile is a plus
Interest in understanding the industry and data available to us
Openness to trying new technologies and approaches

Why ZF in Dublin?
You will work in an open and transparent corporate culture where ownership, accountability, diversity and respect are important values. Our employees are passionate about their job and are all convinced that team spirit and fun are at the heart of our success. Our teamwork in an environment with healthy self-reflection and improvement ingrained in our approach, where outside ideas are genuinely valued, and every member can influence decisions or question current norms.

In this stimulating, fast-growing and challenging environment, we offer you:
Competitive compensation package that includes base salary, bonus scheme and benefits
24 days annual leave, 11 bank holidays (incl. Good Friday)
Pension scheme with up to 5% matching contribution
Comprehensive company health care scheme with Laya – including up to max. 500 EUR yearly refund for Routine Dental
Meaningful development and career opportunities
Flexible and hybrid work models

The position is part of the ZF Global Employee Referral Program.

Required:

3+ years of experience in developing with client-side Web and/or Mobile Technologies.
Good understanding of Object-Oriented Programming and Functional Programming.
Familiar with common Design Patterns, especially the ones with Front End
Extensive experience of HTML5, CSS, JavaScript and TypeScript.
Extensive experience of Angular 2+ or another similar front end technology
Experience with Ionic 3, 4 +.
Experience using NodeJS and NPM.
Experience consuming JSON based RESTful services.
Experience building reactive applications using observables and RxJS.
Experience working with reactive state management using NgRx.
Experience using Git/BitBucket.
Experience using test frameworks such as Karma, Jasmine and Jest.
Strong knowledge of continuous integration, static code analysis and test driven development.

Winner of the Deloitte Best Managed Companies Award (2017 & 2018) our client provides the solutions and consulting services that enable service provider’s fast-track their digital journeys. Their solutions process more than 20 billion events and transactions every day and do this across more than 330 million subscribers for more than 75 service providers worldwide. They deliver the most innovative and high-performance software for these businesses to grow and evolve and they currently partner with 7 out of the 10 largest global telecommunication service providers. Our client is incredibly proud that 11% of mobile data traffic is enabled using their software.
Employing almost 700 people worldwide, since its foundation in 1999, our client has been at the forefront of telecoms software development and innovation. Their success is signified by the many long-term relationships they have fostered with the largest, most progressive, and demanding operators across the globe. They delight at turning innovation into business value.
Overview

Our client’s Solution Delivery team provides real-time software solutions and services to enable service providers to create new revenues from digital services and improve customer engagement. They work with their customers to deliver innovative solutions that drive value and enable change. They deliver end-to-end solutions for digital OSS/BSS and network functions and Big Data solutions. Their team comprises of highly skilled people included developers, testers, solution architects and project/program delivery leads.
What will your job look like?
Coordinate and perform test execution activities, including implementation of test automation procedures and scripts.
Determine the proper prioritization of the testing activities and ensure integrative work and full coverage of test scenarios based on the test plan and observations from concurrent testing activities.
Collect and analyze system behavioral results in order to provide recommendations for issue resolution as well as for system optimization.
Define the execution test plan, scope and resources required and design test solutions to be implemented and executed in alignment with the planned scope customer needs/use.
Responsible to maintain and enhance of the professional and business relationship with the customer and internal partners, as to act as a technical interface for team members and with other teams to resolve issues and communicate conclusions and recommendations.
Be a mentor for new team members, leverage knowledge across test Implementations and projects, and defines the best use/ reuse of testing tools and best practices. Support and promote test efficiency and optimization initiatives.
Ensure that product documentation, test ware and work products used in the activities are of the highest quality to ensure traceability, correctness and compliance to both internal standards and client needs.
All you need is...
Practical experience in documenting Test Cases & Test Plans in a customer facing environment
Experience in executing back-end testing & Automated Testing
Experience in testing interfaces such as JMeter, Diameter, REST & SOAP, Karate, Selenuim
Experience in a Linux / Unix environment and testing in Java environments
Experience with continuous integration systems such as Jenkins
Understanding how to write, modify & read scripting eg Bash, bean shell script, Python
Strong understanding of the end-to-end testing call-flow (Functional test, Regression Test, User Acceptance Test)
Experience with APIs & Cloud-native solutions (Kubernetes)
Understanding of the Telco domain in Charging, BSS/OSS, Core Network environments - an advantage
Why you will love this job:
You will have the opportunity to work with the industry most sophisticated testing technologies and help customers shift into the new testing realities of the digital world.
Overall responsibility and authority for testing engagement with the customer. Finding opportunities of growth and driving them to completion.
We are a dynamic, multi-cultural organization that constantly innovates and empowers our employees to grow. Our people our passionate, daring, and phenomenal teammates that stand by each other with a dedication to creating a diverse, inclusive workplace!
We provide stellar benefits starting from health insurance, life insurance and pension to multiple leave benefits including paid, sick, maternity and paternity leave!
Build an outstanding career path with us with industry leading internal mobility policies. job_title: Technology Consulting (DET) - Business Intelligence Developer - Manager
listing_jobDesc:
As part of our Consulting team, applications are currently being invited for the role of Business Intelligence Developer in Dublin. The successful candidate will have overall responsibility for delivering a high-performing and functional mobile channel.
Skills and attributes
Proven experience in using SAP Business Objects, including version 4.3 specifically in relation to:
Development of reporting universes and individual reports
Troubleshooting issues with existing Business Objects reports
Design and development of dashboard solutions
Business Objects System Administration
Proven development and SAP Business Objects expertise to propose quality solutions for approval by the Department’s appropriate design authorities
Proven expertise in the management and support of the Microsoft Database Developer environment SQL server 2017, particularly the following:
SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Data Extraction, Transform, Load (ETL)
Transactional SQL (T-SQL)
SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS)
DBA design and tuning
Data Warehousing, including design and modelling
Dimensional Modelling
Proven experience in the design, build, and maintenance of a large-scale Data Warehouse and demonstrable ability in recommending best practices
Documentation skills, specifically with regard to reviewing and documenting current Business Intelligence infrastructure and toolsets as well as training material/documentation and in-team training sessions
Proven experience in the design and optimization of ETL scripts
Demonstrable ability in the design, development, and implementation of dashboards and other visualization solutions to present data in an easy-to-use meaningful fashion
Proven experience in supporting project delivery teams in fulfilling reporting solutions, including knowledge of GDPR and privacy by design in reporting solutions
Soft Skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
Good creative problem-solving skills
Self-motivated, flexible, and adaptable
Proven capacity to respond to changes to the program, proactively resolve and deliver to the best possible outcome
Demonstrable ability to propose quality solutions and best practice
Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting skills; sound organizational, negotiating, and decision-making skills
Demonstrable expertise in upskilling colleagues by means of knowledge sharing and skills transfer in specific areas, such as (but not limited to) Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Database Administration and SAP Business Objects
Proven experience in skills transfer/knowledge sharing
To qualify for the role, you must have
Relevant Degree/qualification
Minimum 5 years’ ICT experience with at least 3 years in a .NET enterprise environment
Ideally, you’ll also
Fulfil the role of Team Lead, if required
What working at EY offers
At EY, we’re dedicated to helping our clients, from start-ups to Fortune 500 companies — and the work we do with them is as varied as they are.
You get to work with inspiring and meaningful projects. Our focus is education and coaching alongside practical experience to ensure your personal development. We value our employees, and you will be able to control your own development with an individual progression plan. You will quickly grow into a responsible role with challenging and stimulating assignments. Moreover, you will be part of an interdisciplinary environment that emphasizes high quality and knowledge exchange. Plus, we offer:
Support, coaching, and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
About EY
As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction, and consulting services, we’re using the finance products, expertise, and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities, and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime. And with a commitment to hiring and developing the most passionate people, we’ll make our ambition to be the best employer by 2021 a reality.
Join us in building a better working world.
